body:
# Private Parlor XT
![GitHub Workflow Status (with event)](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT/deploy-nightly.yml?style=for-the-badge&label=Tests)
![GitHub Workflow Status (with event)](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT/deploy-nightly.yml?style=for-the-badge&label=Linux%20Nightly)
![GitHub Workflow Status (with event)](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT/deploy-tag.yml?style=for-the-badge&label=Linux%20Release)

![GitHub top language](https://img.shields.io/github/languages/top/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT?style=for-the-badge&logo=crystal&labelColor=%23000000&color=%23000000)

A featureful Telegram bot to make an anonymous, private group chat on Telegram. 

Inspired by [secretlounge-ng](https://github.com/secretlounge/secretlounge-ng)

Using the [Tourmaline](https://github.com/protoncr/tourmaline) Telegram bot library.

## Notable Features
- Anonymously relay text, photos, albums, polls, videos and more to other people using the bot.
- Restrict new users from sending media by configuring the media limit period.
- Define new ranks via the configuration file with permissions to use various commands and media.
- Make tripcodes harder to crack by adding a salt to the config file.
- Add a spoiler to media before they're sent; or add a spoiler after the fact using the `/spoiler` command.
- Pin and unpin messages to the chat.
- Privately reveal your username to another user.
- Print log messages to a Telegram channel
- Kick users that have been inactive for a configurable period of time.
- Send forwarded messages as photos, videos, animations, etc. to prevent rate limiting.
- Have users automatically send every message with a tripcode using pseudonymous mode.
- Store message history in the database to reduce RAM usage.
- Localization in English, German, and Klingon.
- Persist message history longer or less than 24 hours.
- Prevent new users from joining by closing registration via the config file.
- Upvote and Downvote messages.
- Register commands with BotFather using the config file.
- Enable or disable commands and relaying of certain types of messages using the config file.
- Give users a level based on how much karma they have; user's can sign messages with their level using the `/ksign` command.
- Reduce noise and enforce original messages using the Robot 9000 auto moderator.
- *[And more!](https://github.com/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT/wiki/Features)*
## Installation
Compiling PrivateParlor XT requires having both `crystal` and `shards` installed.

~~~
git clone https://github.com/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT.git
cd private-parlor-xt
shards install
shards build --release
~~~
Alternatively, you can download the precompiled binaries from [Releases](https://github.com/Private-Parlor/Private-Parlor-XT/releases)

## BotFather Setup
1. Start a conversation with [BotFather](https://t.me/botfather)
2. Make a new bot with `/newbot` and answer the prompts
3. `/setprivacy`: enabled
4. `/setjoingroups`: disabled

## Usage

1. Rename `config.yaml.copy` to `config.yaml`
2. Edit config file
  - The config file should at least contain the API Token received from Botfather and a path to a SQLite database
  - Unless the database already exists, Private Parlor XT will create a new SQLite database at the given path
3. Run the `private-parlor-xt` binary

## Development

Development instructions are as follows:
- Ensure code conforms to the [Crystal API coding style](https://crystal-lang.org/reference/1.9/conventions/coding_style.html)
- Explicitly define return types and types for variables and parameters
- Document your code
- Write some specs for your code
- Lint using Ameba; remove as many warnings as possible

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/Private-Parlor/private-parlor-xt/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Charybdis](https://github.com/Charibdys) - creator and maintainer

class_methods.name: command_disabled
class_methods.doc: Queues a command_disabled system reply when the `CommandHandler` was disabled
class_methods.summary: Queues a command_disabled system reply when the CommandHandler was disabled

def.name: command_disabled
def.body:
if info = message.from
else
  return
end
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), info.id.to_i64, services.replies.command_disabled)

def.name: generate_callback_query_handlers
def.body:
arr = [] of Tourmaline::CallbackQueryHandler
{% if @type.has_constant?("StatisticsQueryHandler") %}
      return arr unless config.statistics

      handler = StatisticsQueryHandler.new(config)

      arr << Tourmaline::CallbackQueryHandler.new(/statistics-next/) do |ctx|
        next unless query = ctx.callback_query
        next unless message = ctx.message
        next if message.date == 0 # Message is inaccessible

        handler.do(query, services)
      end
    {% end %}
arr

class_methods.name: initialize_bot
class_methods.doc:
Reads from the config file and initialize `Services`, recurring tasks, and bot handlers

Returns the initialized `Services` object
class_methods.summary: Reads from the config file and initialize Services, recurring tasks, and bot handlers

def.name: initialize_bot
def.body:
config = Config.parse_config
if client
else
  client = Client.new(config.token)
end
client.default_parse_mode = Tourmaline::ParseMode::MarkdownV2
services = Services.new(config, client)
start_tasks(config, services)
initialize_handlers(client, config, services)
services

class_methods.name: initialize_handlers
class_methods.doc: Initialize bot handlers, such as `CommandHandler`, `HearsHandler`, `CallbackHandler`, and `UpdateHandler`
class_methods.args_string: (client : Tourmaline::Client, config : Config, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: initialize_handlers
def.body:
events = [] of Tourmaline::EventHandler
events = events.concat(generate_command_handlers(config, client, services))
events = events.concat(generate_hears_handlers(config, services))
events = events.concat(generate_callback_query_handlers(config, services))
events.each do |handler|
  client.register(handler)
end
generate_update_handlers(config, client, services)

class_methods.name: kick_inactive_users
class_methods.doc: Force-leave users whose last active time is creater than the given `Time::Span` *limit*
class_methods.summary: Force-leave users whose last active time is creater than the given Time::Span limit

def.name: kick_inactive_users
def.body:
(services.database.inactive_users(limit)).each do |user|
  user.set_left
  services.database.update_user(user)
  services.relay.reject_inactive_user_messages(user.id)
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.left, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name})
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.inactive, {"time" => limit.days.to_s})
  services.relay.log_output(log)
  services.relay.send_to_user(nil, user.id, response)
end

class_methods.name: start_tasks
class_methods.doc:
Initializes recurring tasks, such as:
  - Warning expiration
  - Message expiration (if toggled)
  - Spam cooldown expiration (if toggled)
  - Inactive user kicking (if toggled)
class_methods.summary: Initializes recurring tasks, such as: - Warning expiration - Message expiration (if toggled) - Spam cooldown expiration (if toggled) - Inactive user kicking (if toggled)

def.name: start_tasks
def.body:
Tasker.every(15.minutes) do
  services.database.expire_warnings(config.warn_lifespan.hours)
end
if config.message_lifespan > 0
  Tasker.every(config.message_lifespan.hours * (1 / 4)) do
    services.history.expire
  end
end
if spam = services.spam
  Tasker.every(config.spam_interval.seconds) do
    spam.expire
  end
end
if config.inactivity_limit > 0
  Tasker.every(6.hours) do
    kick_inactive_users(config.inactivity_limit.days, services)
  end
end

class_methods.name: terminate_program
class_methods.doc:
Stop the message sending routine, send remaining messages in the queue
and terminate the program
class_methods.summary: Stop the message sending routine, send remaining messages in the queue and terminate the program

def.name: terminate_program
def.body:
services.relay.stop_polling
routine.cancel
loop do
  if services.relay.send_message(services)
    break
  end
end
begin
  services.database.close
rescue
  nil
end
Log.notice do
  "Sent last messages in queue. Shutting down..."
end
exit

def.name: valid_message
def.body:
if message = ctx.message
else
  return
end
if message.date == 0
  return
end
message.as(Tourmaline::Message)

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming albums

Returns `true` if the user is spamming albums, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming albums
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_album?(user.id)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: spend_karma
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for an album
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for an album
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : User

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_media_group >= 0
else
  return user
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return user
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_media_group)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send an album when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for albums is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send an album when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_media_group >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_media_group
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_media_group.to_s, "type" => "album"}))
end
true

instance_methods.name: album_input
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `Tourmaline::InputMedia` from the media in the given *message*, if available.

Returns `nil` if there was no media in the *message* to create a `Tourmaline::InputMedia`
instance_methods.summary: Returns the Tourmaline::InputMedia from the media in the given message, if available.
instance_methods.args_string: (message : Tourmaline::Message, caption : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), allow_spoilers : Bool | Nil = false) : AlbumMedia | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (message : Tourmaline::Message, caption : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), allow_spoilers : Bool | Nil = false) : AlbumMedia | Nil

def.name: album_input
def.body:
if media = message.photo.last?
  Tourmaline::InputMediaPhoto.new(media.file_id, caption: caption, caption_entities: entities, parse_mode: nil, has_spoiler: message.has_media_spoiler? && allow_spoilers, show_caption_above_media: message.show_caption_above_media?)
else
  if media = message.video
    Tourmaline::InputMediaVideo.new(media.file_id, caption: caption, caption_entities: entities, parse_mode: nil, has_spoiler: message.has_media_spoiler? && allow_spoilers, show_caption_above_media: message.show_caption_above_media?)
  else
    if media = message.audio
      Tourmaline::InputMediaAudio.new(media.file_id, caption: caption, caption_entities: entities, parse_mode: nil)
    else
      if media = message.document
        Tourmaline::InputMediaDocument.new(media.file_id, caption: caption, caption_entities: entities, parse_mode: nil)
      else
        return
      end
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: relay_album
instance_methods.doc:
Relays the given *album* after an arbitrary amount of time, waiting for the rest of the media group updates to come in

Returns early if the album is already queued for relaying, and adds the *input* to the Album object.
instance_methods.summary: Relays the given album after an arbitrary amount of time, waiting for the rest of the media group updates to come in
instance_methods.args_string: (albums : Hash(String, Album), album : String, message_id : MessageID, input : AlbumMedia, user : User, receivers : Array(UserID), reply_msids : Hash(UserID, ReplyParameters), effect : String | Nil, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (albums : Hash(String, Album), album : String, message_id : MessageID, input : AlbumMedia, user : User, receivers : Array(UserID), reply_msids : Hash(UserID, ReplyParameters), effect : String | Nil, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: relay_album
def.body:
if albums[album]?
  albums[album].message_ids << message_id
  albums[album].media << input
  return
end
media_group = Album.new(message_id, input)
albums.merge!({album => media_group})
Tasker.in(WAIT_TIME) do
  if prepared_album = albums.delete(album)
  else
    next
  end
  if prepared_album.media.any? do |item|
    (!item.is_a?(Tourmaline::InputMediaDocument | Tourmaline::InputMediaAudio)) && item.show_caption_above_media?
  end
    prepared_album.media.each do |item|
      if item.is_a?(Tourmaline::InputMediaPhoto | Tourmaline::InputMediaVideo)
        item.show_caption_above_media = true
      end
    end
  end
  cached_messages = Array(MessageID).new
  prepared_album.message_ids.each do |msid|
    cached_messages << (services.history.new_message(user.id, msid))
  end
  services.relay.send_album(AlbumRelayParameters.new(origins: cached_messages, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, replies: reply_msids, media: prepared_album.media, effect: effect))
end

instance_methods.doc: Checks if the audio message meets requirements and relays it
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the audio message meets requirements and relays it

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if meets_requirements?(message)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Audio, services)
else
  return
end
if sufficient_karma?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
if audio = message.audio
else
  return
end
caption, entities = Format.text_and_entities(message, user, services)
if caption
else
  return
end
reply_messages = reply_receivers(message, user, services)
if reply_messages
else
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
record_message_statistics(Statistics::Messages::Audio, services)
user = spend_karma(user, services)
new_message = services.history.new_message(user.id, message.message_id.to_i64)
update_user_activity(user, services)
receivers = message_receivers(user, services)
services.relay.send_audio(RelayParameters.new(original_message: new_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, replies: reply_messages, media: audio.file_id, text: caption, entities: entities, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming audio messages

Returns `true` if the user is spamming audio messages, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming audio messages
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_audio?(user.id)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: spend_karma
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for a audio message
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for a audio message

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_audio >= 0
else
  return user
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_audio)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a audio message when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for audio messages is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a audio message when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_audio >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_audio
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_audio.to_s, "type" => "audio"}))
end
true

types.doc: A handler for `Rank` and determines if a `Rank` has access to certain commands and message types

constructors.doc: Creates an instance of `AuthorizedRanks`

instance_methods.name: authorized?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if user rank has the given command permission; user is authorized.

Returns `false` otherwise, or `nil` if the user rank does not exist in `ranks`
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if user rank has the given command permission; user is authorized.

instance_methods.name: authorized?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if user rank has the given message permission; user is authorized.

Returns `false` otherwise, or `nil` if the user rank does not exist in `ranks`
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if user rank has the given message permission; user is authorized.

instance_methods.name: authorized?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the first symbol found from intersecting the user command permissions and the given permissions; user is authorized.

Returns`nil` if the user rank does not exist in `ranks` or if the rank does not have any of the given permissions.

Used for checking groups of command permissions that are similar.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the first symbol found from intersecting the user command permissions and the given permissions; user is authorized.

instance_methods.name: can_demote?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if the user to be demoted (receiver) can be demoted with the given rank.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the user to be demoted (receiver) can be demoted with the given rank.
instance_methods.args_string: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, receiver : Int32) : Bool
instance_methods.args_html: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, receiver : Int32) : Bool

instance_methods.name: can_promote?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the user to be promoted (receiver) can be promoted with the given rank.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the user to be promoted (receiver) can be promoted with the given rank.
instance_methods.args_string: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, receiver : Int32, permission : CommandPermissions) : Bool
instance_methods.args_html: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, receiver : Int32, permission : CommandPermissions) : Bool

def.name: can_promote?
def.body:
if (rank <= receiver || rank > invoker) || (receiver == -10)
  return false
end
if rank <= invoker && (permission == CommandPermissions::Promote)
  true
else
  if rank < invoker && (permission == CommandPermissions::PromoteLower)
    true
  else
    if (rank == invoker) && (permission == CommandPermissions::PromoteSame)
      true
    else
      false
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: can_ranksay?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if the user can sign a message with the given rank.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the user can sign a message with the given rank.
instance_methods.args_string: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, invoker_permission : CommandPermissions, rank_permission : CommandPermissions | Nil = nil) : Bool
instance_methods.args_html: (rank : Int32, invoker : Int32, invoker_permission : CommandPermissions, rank_permission : CommandPermissions | Nil = nil) : Bool

def.name: can_ranksay?
def.body:
if (rank == -10) || rank_permission.nil?
  return false
end
(rank < invoker && (invoker_permission == CommandPermissions::RanksayLower)) || (rank == invoker)

instance_methods.name: find_rank
instance_methods.doc:
Finds a rank from a given rank value
or iterates through the ranks hash for a rank with a given name

Returns a 2-tuple with the rank value and the rank associated with that rank,
or `nil` if no rank exists with the given values.
instance_methods.summary: Finds a rank from a given rank value or iterates through the ranks hash for a rank with a given name
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, value : Int32 | Nil = nil) : Tuple(Int32, Rank) | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, value : Int32 | Nil = nil) : Tuple(Int32, Rank) | Nil

def.name: find_rank
def.body:
if value && @ranks[value]?
  {value, @ranks[value]}
else
  @ranks.find do |k, v|
    ((ranksay(v.name)) == name) || (k == value)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: ranksay
instance_methods.doc: Converts the given *rank* string into a string that can be used for a `RanksayCommand`, preceding the '-say' substring
instance_methods.summary: Converts the given rank string into a string that can be used for a RanksayCommand, preceding the '-say' substring

def.name: ranksay
def.body:
rank = rank.gsub("_", " ")
rank = rank.gsub(/[[:punct:]]|[^[:ascii:]]/, "")
rank = rank.gsub(/\s{1,}/, "_")
rank.downcase

def.name: blacklist_from_reply
def.body:
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if blacklist_user(reply_user, user, message, reason, services)
else
  return
end
original_message = delete_messages(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id, reply_user.debug_enabled, services)
if original_message
  original_message = ReplyParameters.new(original_message)
end
send_messages(reason, reply_user, user, original_message, message, services)

instance_methods.name: blacklist_user
instance_methods.doc: Blacklists the *blacklisted_user* and removes all messages sent by and addressed to him if his rank does not equal to or exceed *invoker's* rank
instance_methods.summary: Blacklists the blacklisted_user and removes all messages sent by and addressed to him if his rank does not equal to or exceed invoker's rank
instance_methods.args_string: (blacklisted_user : User, invoker : User, message : MessageID, reason : String | Nil, services : Services) : Bool | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (blacklisted_user : User, invoker : User, message : MessageID, reason : String | Nil, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: blacklist_user
def.body:
if blacklisted_user.rank < invoker.rank
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), invoker.id, services.replies.fail)
end
update_user_activity(invoker, services)
blacklisted_user.blacklist(reason)
services.database.update_user(blacklisted_user)
services.relay.reject_blacklisted_messages(blacklisted_user.id)
true

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Blacklists the user described in the *message* text or blacklists the sender of the message it replies to, if *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Blacklists the user described in the message text or blacklists the sender of the message it replies to, if message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Blacklist, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = message.reply_to_message
  arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  blacklist_from_reply(arg, user, message.message_id.to_i64, reply, services)
else
  if (args = Format.get_args(message.text, count: 2)) && args.size > 0
  else
    return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
  end
  blacklist_from_args(args, user, message.message_id.to_i64, services)
end

instance_methods.name: send_messages
instance_methods.doc: Queues success and blacklisted responses
instance_methods.summary: Queues success and blacklisted responses
instance_methods.args_string: (reason : String | Nil, blacklisted_user : User, invoker : User, deleted_message : ReplyParameters | Nil, invoker_message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (reason : String | Nil, blacklisted_user : User, invoker : User, deleted_message : ReplyParameters | Nil, invoker_message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: send_messages
def.body:
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(reason, services.replies)})
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.blacklisted, {"id" => blacklisted_user.id.to_s, "name" => blacklisted_user.formatted_name, "invoker" => invoker.formatted_name, "reason" => Format.reason_log(reason, services.logs)})
services.relay.send_to_user(deleted_message, blacklisted_user.id, response)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(invoker_message), invoker.id, services.replies.success)

instance_methods.doc:
Deletes old messages from the `History`

This should be invoked as a recurring task
instance_methods.summary: Deletes old messages from the History

def.name: expire
def.body:
msids = Set(MessageID).new
@message_map.each_value do |message_group|
  if !(expired?(message_group))
    next
  end
  msids << message_group.origin
end
msids.each do |msid|
  delete_message_group(msid)
end
if msids.size > 0
  Log.debug do
    "Expired #{msids.size} messages from the cache"
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Get all message IDs sent by a given user for purging messages
instance_methods.summary: Get all message IDs sent by a given user for purging messages

def.name: messages_from_user
def.body:
user_msgs = Set(MessageID).new
@message_map.each_value do |msg|
  if msg.sender == user
  else
    next
  end
  if msg.sent <= (Time.utc - 48.hours)
    next
  end
  user_msgs.add(msg.origin)
end
user_msgs

instance_methods.name: purge_receivers
instance_methods.doc:
Get a hash containing an array of message IDs to delete associated with the users who received a message in the given set.
Used for the `PurgeCommand`
NOTE: The returned array of message IDs should be sorted in descending order (most recent messages first)
instance_methods.summary: Get a hash containing an array of message IDs to delete associated with the users who received a message in the given set.

def.name: purge_receivers
def.body:
hash = {} of UserID => Array(MessageID)
messages = messages.to_a.sort do |a, b|
  b <=> a
end
messages.each do |msid|
  @message_map[msid].receivers.each do |receiver, receiver_msid|
    if hash[receiver]?
      hash[receiver] << receiver_msid
    else
      hash[receiver] = [receiver_msid]
    end
  end
end
hash

else

end

def.body:
if user.blacklisted?
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(user.blacklist_reason, services.replies)})

instance_methods.name: user_from_callback
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` associated with the *callback* if the `User` could be found in the `Database`.
This will also update the `User`'s username and realname if they have changed since the last message.

Returns `nil`  if:
  - `User` does not exist in the `Database`
  - `User` is blacklisted
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User associated with the callback if the User could be found in the Database.

def.name: user_from_callback
def.body:
info = callback.from
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(nil, info.id.to_i64, services.replies.not_in_chat)
end
if user.can_use_command?
else
  return deny_user(user, services)
end
user.update_names(info.username, info.full_name)
user

types.name: CommandHandler
types.doc:
A base class for handling a Telegram command

Handlers that are meant to respond to commands (messages that start with '/') should inherit this class,
and include a `RespondsTo` annotation to have it be usable by the bot.
types.summary: A base class for handling a Telegram command

instance_methods.name: authorized?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user's `Rank` contain the given `CommandPermissions`

Returns `true` if it does, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user's Rank contain the given CommandPermissions
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, permission : CommandPermissions, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: authorized?
def.body:
if services.access.authorized?(user.rank, permission)
else
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.command_disabled)
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: authorized?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user's `Rank` contains any of the given `CommandPermissions`

If it does, it returns the one `CommandPermissions`
Returns `nil` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user's Rank contains any of the given CommandPermissions
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, *permissions : CommandPermissions) : CommandPermissions | Nil

def.name: authorized?
def.body:
if authority = services.access.authorized?(user.rank, *permissions)
  authority
else
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.command_disabled)
end

instance_methods.name: delete_messages
instance_methods.doc:
Deletes the message group associated with the given *message* ID in the chat and from the `History`

Returns the original `MessageID` of the associated message group
instance_methods.summary: Deletes the message group associated with the given message ID in the chat and from the History
instance_methods.args_string: (message : MessageID, user : UserID, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil, services : Services) : MessageID | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (message : MessageID, user : UserID, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil, services : Services) : MessageID | Nil

def.name: delete_messages
def.body:
reply_msids = services.history.receivers(message)
if debug_enabled
else
  reply_msids.delete(user)
end
reply_msids.each do |receiver, receiver_message|
  services.relay.delete_message(receiver, receiver_message)
end
services.history.delete_message_group(message)

instance_methods.name: deny_user
instance_methods.doc: Queues a system reply when the user is blacklisted and cannot use a command
instance_methods.summary: Queues a system reply when the user is blacklisted and cannot use a command

def.name: deny_user
def.body:
if user.blacklisted?
else
  return
end
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(user.blacklist_reason, services.replies)})
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, user.id, response)

instance_methods.name: remove_command_entity
instance_methods.doc:
Removes the bot command message entity from *entities* and subtracts the index of the *arg* start from the offset of each message entity in *entities*

Returns an array of updated `Tourmaline::MessageEntity`
instance_methods.summary: Removes the bot command message entity from entities and subtracts the index of the arg start from the offset of each message entity in entities
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), arg : String) : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), arg : String) : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)

def.name: remove_command_entity
def.body:
if command_entity = entities.find do |item|
  (item.type == "bot_command") && (item.offset == 0)
end
  entities = entities - [command_entity]
end
arg_offset = text[...(text.index(arg))].to_utf16.size
Format.reset_entities(entities, arg_offset)

instance_methods.name: user_from_message
instance_methods.doc: Gets the `User` with updated names from the given *message* and returns it if the message is a command, the user exists, and the user is not blacklisted
instance_methods.summary: Gets the User with updated names from the given message and returns it if the message is a command, the user exists, and the user is not blacklisted

def.name: user_from_message
def.body:
if info = message.from
else
  return
end
if text = message.text || message.caption
  if text.starts_with?('/')
  else
    return
  end
end
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(nil, info.id.to_i64, services.replies.not_in_chat)
end
if user.can_use_command?
else
  return deny_user(user, services)
end
user.update_names(info.username, info.full_name)
user

types.name: CommandPermissions
types.doc:
Commands and command types which can be given to a `Rank` to permit using certain commands

## Commands permitted for each type:

`Users`: View the exact number of joined, left, and blacklisted users

`Upvote`: Upvote messages

`Downvote`: Downvote messages

`Promote`: Promote users to the same rank AND/OR lower ranks (Mutually exclusive with `PromoteSame` and `PromoteLower`)

`PromoteLower`: Promote users to lower ranks ONLY (Mutually exclusive with `Promote` and `PromoteSame`)

`PromoteSame`: Promote users to the same rank ONLY (Mutually exclusive with `Promote` and `PromoteLower`)

`Demote`: Demote users of lower rank

`Sign`: Sign a message with the user's username

`TSign`: Sign a message with a tripcode

`Reveal`: Privately reveal username to another user

`Spoiler`: Add or remove a spoiler from a media message using `SpoilerCommand`

`Pin`: Pin a message to the chat

`Unpin`: Unpin the a message or the recent message

`Ranksay`: Sign a message with rank name (Mutually exclusive with `RanksayLower`)

`RanksayLower`: Sign a message with rank name OR name of a lower rank IF that rank can ranksay (Mutually exclusive with `Ranksay`)

`Warn`: Warn a message and give the user a cooldown

`Delete`: Delete a message and give the user a cooldown

`Uncooldown`: Remove a cooldown from a user

`Remove`: Delete message without giving the user a cooldown

`Purge`: Delete all messages from recently blacklisted users

`Blacklist`: Ban a user from the chat

`Whitelist`: Invite a user to the chat (Applicable only if registration is closed)

`MotdSet`: Modify and set the MOTD/rules

`RankedInfo`: Get info (OID, karma, cooldown duration) of a another user

`Unblacklist`: Unban a user from the chat
types.summary: Commands and command types which can be given to a Rank to permit using certain commands

types.name: Config
types.doc: A container for values deserialized from the configuration file
types.summary: A container for values deserialized from the configuration file

constructors.name: parse_config
constructors.doc: Deserializes the values from the config file and returns a validated `Config`
constructors.summary: Deserializes the values from the config file and returns a validated Config

def.name: parse_config
def.body:
begin
  check_config(Config.from_yaml(File.open("config.yaml")))
rescue ex : YAML::ParseException
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Could not parse the given value at row #{ex.line_number}. This could be because a required value was not set or the wrong type was given."
  end
  exit
rescue ex : File::NotFoundError | File::AccessDeniedError
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Could not open \"./config.yaml\". Exiting..."
  end
  exit
end

instance_methods.doc: Checks if the contact message meets requirements and relays it

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if message.forward_origin
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Contact, services)
else
  return
end
if sufficient_karma?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
if contact = message.contact
else
  return
end
reply_messages = reply_receivers(message, user, services)
if reply_messages
else
  return
end
record_message_statistics(Statistics::Messages::Contacts, services)
user = spend_karma(user, services)
new_message = services.history.new_message(user.id, message.message_id.to_i64)
update_user_activity(user, services)
receivers = message_receivers(user, services)

instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming contacts

Returns `true` if the user is spamming contacts, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming contacts
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_contact?(user.id)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: spend_karma
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for a contacts message
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for a contacts message

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_contact >= 0
else
  return user
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_contact)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a contacts when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for contacts is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a contacts when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_contact >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_contact
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_contact.to_s, "type" => "contact"}))
end
true

types.name: DeleteCommand
types.doc: A command used to delete a message and give its sender a cooldown and warning
types.summary: A command used to delete a message and give its sender a cooldown and warning

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Deletes the reply of the given *message* for everybody and gives a cooldown and warning to the user who sent it, if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Deletes the reply of the given message for everybody and gives a cooldown and warning to the user who sent it, if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Delete, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
original_message = delete_messages(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id, reply_user.debug_enabled, services)
duration = reply_user.cooldown(services.config.cooldown_base)
reply_user.warn(services.config.warn_lifespan)
reply_user.decrement_karma(services.config.warn_deduction)
services.database.update_user(reply_user)
reason = Format.get_arg(message.text)
cooldown_until = Format.time_span(duration, services.locale)
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.message_deleted, {"reason" => Format.reason(reason, services.replies), "duration" => cooldown_until})
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.message_deleted, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "msid" => original_message.to_s, "oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id, "duration" => cooldown_until, "reason" => Format.reason_log(reason, services.logs)})
if original_message
  original_message = ReplyParameters.new(original_message)
end
services.relay.send_to_user(original_message, reply_user.id, response)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

types.name: DemoteCommand
types.doc: A command used to demote a user to the default rank or a given rank
types.summary: A command used to demote a user to the default rank or a given rank

instance_methods.name: demote_from_args
instance_methods.doc:
Demotes a user given in the *text* to the default rank if only one argument (the user's identifier) was given,
or demotes to the given rank if two arguments (the user's identifier and name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.summary: Demotes a user given in the text to the default rank if only one argument (the user's identifier) was given, or demotes to the given rank if two arguments (the user's identifier and name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String | Nil, user : User, message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String | Nil, user : User, message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: demote_from_args
def.body:
if (args = Format.get_args(text, count: 2)) && args.size > 0
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if args.size == 1
  tuple = {services.config.default_rank, services.access.ranks[services.config.default_rank]}
else
  if args.size == 2
    tuple = services.access.find_rank(args[1].downcase, args[1].to_i?)
  end
end
if tuple
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.no_rank_found, {"ranks" => services.access.rank_names(limit: user.rank).to_s}))
end
if demoted_user = services.database.get_user_by_arg(args[0])
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.no_user_found)
end
if services.access.can_demote?(tuple[0], user.rank, demoted_user.rank)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
demoted_user.set_rank(tuple[0])
services.database.update_user(demoted_user)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.demoted, {"id" => demoted_user.id.to_s, "name" => demoted_user.formatted_name, "rank" => tuple[1].name, "invoker" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.success)

instance_methods.doc:
Demotes a user who sent the *reply* message to the default rank if no *arg* was given,
or demotes to the given rank in *arg* if one argument (name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.summary: Demotes a user who sent the reply message to the default rank if no arg was given, or demotes to the given rank in arg if one argument (name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.args_string: (arg : String | Nil, user : User, message : MessageID, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (arg : String | Nil, user : User, message : MessageID, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: demote_from_reply
def.body:
if arg
  tuple = services.access.find_rank(arg.downcase, arg.to_i?)
else
  tuple = {services.config.default_rank, services.access.ranks[services.config.default_rank]}
end
if tuple
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.no_rank_found, {"ranks" => services.access.rank_names(limit: user.rank).to_s}))
end
if demoted_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if services.access.can_demote?(tuple[0], user.rank, demoted_user.rank)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
demoted_user.set_rank(tuple[0])
services.database.update_user(demoted_user)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.demoted, {"id" => demoted_user.id.to_s, "name" => demoted_user.formatted_name, "rank" => tuple[1].name, "invoker" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.success)

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Demotes the user described in the *message* text or demotes the sender of the message it replies to, if *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Demotes the user described in the message text or demotes the sender of the message it replies to, if message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Demote, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = message.reply_to_message
  arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  demote_from_reply(arg, user, message.message_id.to_i64, reply, services)
else
  demote_from_args(message.text, user, message.message_id.to_i64, services)
end

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Downvote, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
if downvote_message(user, reply_user, message, reply, services)
else
  return
end
record_message_statistics(services)
send_replies(user, reply_user, message, reply, services)

instance_methods.name: downvote_message
instance_methods.doc:
Adds user's dowvote to message history and update reply_user's karma
Returns false if user has already downvoted the message or user attempted
to remove his own karma
instance_methods.summary: Adds user's dowvote to message history and update reply_user's karma Returns false if user has already downvoted the message or user attempted to remove his own karma
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, reply_user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: downvote_message
def.body:
if user.id == reply_user.id
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.downvoted_own_message)
  return false
end
if !(services.history.add_rating(reply.message_id.to_i64, user.id))
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.already_voted)
  return false
end
reply_user.decrement_karma
services.database.update_user(reply_user)
true

instance_methods.name: karma_level_down
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the user has lost a karma level when karma levels are set, and if so, queues a 'leveled down' response
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has lost a karma level when karma levels are set, and if so, queues a 'leveled down' response
instance_methods.args_string: (reply_user : User, reply_parameters : ReplyParameters | Nil, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: karma_level_down
def.body:
if services.config.karma_levels.empty?
  return
end
last_level = (services.config.karma_levels.find({(..), ""}) do |range, _|
  range === (reply_user.karma + 1)
end)[1]
current_level = (services.config.karma_levels.find({(..), ""}) do |range, _|
  range === reply_user.karma
end)[1]
if last_level == current_level
  return
end
services.relay.send_to_user(reply_parameters, reply_user.id, Format.substitute_message(services.replies.karma_level_down, {"level" => current_level}))

instance_methods.doc: Records message statistics about downvotes if the `Statistics` module is enabled
instance_methods.summary: Records message statistics about downvotes if the Statistics module is enabled

def.name: record_message_statistics
def.body:
if stats = services.stats
else
  return
end
stats.increment_downvotes

instance_methods.name: send_replies
instance_methods.doc:
Queues 'gave downvote' and 'got downvoted' replies for the *user* and *reply_user*, respectively

Includes a reason for the downvote if karma reasons are enabled.
instance_methods.summary: Queues 'gave downvote' and 'got downvoted' replies for the user and reply_user, respectively
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, reply_user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: send_replies
def.body:
if services.config.karma_reasons
  reason = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  if reason
    reason = truncate_karma_reason(reason)
    services.relay.log_output(Format.substitute_message(services.logs.downvoted, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id, "reason" => reason}))
  end
end
gave_downvote_reply = karma_reason(reason, services.replies.gave_downvote, services)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, gave_downvote_reply)
if reply_user.hide_karma
else
  reply_msid = services.history.receiver_message(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id)
  if reply_msid
    reply_parameters = ReplyParameters.new(reply_msid)
  end
  karma_level_down(reply_user, reply_parameters, services)
  got_downvote_reply = karma_reason(reason, services.replies.got_downvote, services)
  services.relay.send_to_user(reply_parameters, reply_user.id, got_downvote_reply)
end

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming downvotes

Returns `true` if the user is spamming downvotes, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming downvotes
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_downvote?(user.id, services.config.downvote_limit_interval)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.downvote_spam)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: user_from_message
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` associated with the message if the `User` could be found in the `Database`.
This will also update the `User`'s username and realname if they have changed since the last message.

Returns `nil`  if:
  - Message has no sender
  - `User` does not exist in the `Database`
  - `User` cannot use a command due to being blacklisted
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User associated with the message if the User could be found in the Database.

def.name: user_from_message
def.body:
if info = message.from
else
  return
end
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(nil, info.id.to_i64, services.replies.not_in_chat)
end
if user.can_use_command?
else
  return deny_user(user, services)
end
user.update_names(info.username, info.full_name)
user

instance_methods.name: allow_text?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks the content of the message *text* and determines if it should be relayed.

Returns `true` if the *text* is empty or permitted, `false` if the text has mathematical alphanumeric symbols, as they contain bold and italic characters.
instance_methods.summary: Checks the content of the message text and determines if it should be relayed.

def.name: allow_text?
def.body:
if text.empty?
  true
else
  if text.codepoints.any? do |codepoint|
    (119808..120831).includes?(codepoint)
  end
    false
  else
    true
  end
end

instance_methods.name: check_text
instance_methods.doc: Checks the given *text* for invalid characters
instance_methods.summary: Checks the given text for invalid characters
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String, user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: check_text
def.body:
if message.preformatted?
  return true
end
if r9k = services.robot9000
  if r9k.allow_text?(text)
  else
    services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.rejected_message)
    return false
  end
else
  if Format.allow_text?(text)
  else
    services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.rejected_message)
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.name: generate_tripcode
instance_methods.doc:
Generate a 2channel or secure 8chan style tripcode from a given string in the format `name#pass`.

Returns a named tuple containing the tripname and tripcode.

Using procedures based on code by Fredrick R. Brennan and Tinyboard Development Group

8chan secure tripcode:
Copyright (c) 2010-2014 Tinyboard Development Group

github.com/ctrlcctrlv/infinity/blob/1535f2c976bdc503c12b5e92e605ee665e3239e7/inc/functions.php#L2755

2channel tripcode:
Copyright (c) Fredrick R. Brennan, 2020

github.com/ctrlcctrlv/tripkeys/blob/33dcb519a8c08185aecba15eee9aa80760dddc87/doc/2ch_tripcode_annotated.pl
instance_methods.summary: Generate a 2channel or secure 8chan style tripcode from a given string in the format name#pass.

def.name: generate_tripcode
def.body:
split = tripkey.split('#', 2)
name = split[0]
pass = split[1]
if services.config.flag_signatures
  return {name, ""}
end
if !services.config.tripcode_salt.empty?
  pass = String.new(pass.encode("Shift_JIS"), "Shift_JIS")
  trip = Digest::SHA1.base64digest(pass + services.config.tripcode_salt)
  tripcode = "!#{trip[0...10]}"
else
  character_map = {':' => 'A', ';' => 'B', '<' => 'C', '=' => 'D', '>' => 'E', '?' => 'F', '@' => 'G', '[' => 'a', '\\' => 'b', ']' => 'c', '^' => 'd', '_' => 'e', '`' => 'f'}
  salt = (pass + "H.")[1, 2]
  salt = salt.gsub(/[^\.-z]/, '.')
  salt = salt.gsub(character_map)
  trip = String.new(LibCrypt.crypt(pass[...8], salt))
  tripcode = "!#{trip[-10...]}"
end
{name, tripcode}

instance_methods.doc: Prepend the user's tripcode to the message
instance_methods.summary: Prepend the user's tripcode to the message
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Tuple(String | Nil, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

def.name: prepend_pseudonym
def.body:
if services.config.pseudonymous
else
  return {text, entities}
end
if message.preformatted?
  return {text, entities}
end
if tripcode = user.tripcode
else
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.no_tripcode_set)
  return {nil, [] of Tourmaline::MessageEntity}
end
name, tripcode = Format.generate_tripcode(tripcode, services)
if services.config.flag_signatures
  header, entities = Format.flag_sign(name, entities)
else
  header, entities = Format.tripcode_sign(name, tripcode, entities)
end
return {header + text, entities}

instance_methods.doc: Replaces appends links contained in text link entities to the end of the given *text*
instance_methods.summary: Replaces appends links contained in text link entities to the end of the given text

def.name: replace_links
def.body:
entities.each do |entity|
  if (entity.type == "text_link") && (url = entity.url)
    if url.starts_with?("tg://")
      next
    end
    if (url.includes?("://t.me/")) && (url.includes?("?start="))
      next
    end
    text = text + "\n(#{url})"
  end
end
text

instance_methods.name: time_span
instance_methods.doc: Format a time span using localized time units
instance_methods.summary: Format a time span using localized time units

def.name: time_span
def.body:
case
when time < 1.minute
  "#{time.to_i}#{locale.time_units[4]}"
when time < 1.hour
  "#{time.total_minutes.floor.to_i}#{locale.time_units[3]}"
when time < 1.day
  "#{time.total_hours.floor.to_i}#{locale.time_units[2]}"
when time < 1.week
  "#{time.total_days.floor.to_i}#{locale.time_units[1]}"
else
  "#{time.total_weeks.floor.to_i}#{locale.time_units[0]}"
end

def.name: tripcode_sign
def.body:
header = "#{name} #{tripcode}:\n"
header_size = header[..-3].to_utf16.size

instance_methods.name: update_network_links
instance_methods.doc: Returns a text link message entities corresponding to the network links in *text*, linking to their respective chats
instance_methods.summary: Returns a text link message entities corresponding to the network links in text, linking to their respective chats
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), linked_network : Hash(String, String)) : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), linked_network : Hash(String, String)) : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)

def.name: update_network_links
def.body:
offset = 0
while (start_index = text.index(/>>>\/\w+\//, offset)) && (start_index != nil)
  chat_string_index = start_index + 4
  if end_index = text.index('/', chat_string_index)
  else
    offset = chat_string_index
    next
  end
  if chat = linked_network[text[chat_string_index...end_index]]?
  else
    offset = chat_string_index
    next
  end
  entities << (Tourmaline::MessageEntity.new("text_link", text[...start_index].to_utf16.size, text[start_index..end_index].to_utf16.size, "tg://resolve?domain=#{chat}"))
  offset = end_index
end
entities

def.name: deanonymous_poll?
def.body:
if (poll = message.poll) && (!poll.is_anonymous?)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.deanon_poll)

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the forwarded message meets requirements and relays it
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the forwarded message meets requirements and relays it

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Forward, services)
else
  return
end
if deanonymous_poll?(user, message, services)
  return
end
if sufficient_karma?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
record_message_statistics(Statistics::Messages::Forwards, services)
user = spend_karma(user, services)
new_message = services.history.new_message(user.id, message.message_id.to_i64)
update_user_activity(user, services)
receivers = message_receivers(user, services)
services.relay.send_forward(RelayParameters.new(original_message: new_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil), message.message_id.to_i64)

Checks if the user is spamming forwarded messages

Returns `true` if the user is spamming forwarded messages, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming forwarded messages
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_forward?(user.id)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: spend_karma
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for a forwarded message
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for a forwarded message

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_forwarded_message >= 0
else
  return user
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_forwarded_message)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a forwarded message when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for forwarded messages is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a forwarded message when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_forwarded_message >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_forwarded_message
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_forwarded_message.to_s, "type" => "forward"}))
end
true

types.name: Hears
types.doc:
Annotation for Telegram hears handlers

## Keys and Values:

`pattern`
:     a `StringLiteral` or `RegexLiteral` that triggers this `HearsHandler` when it is found in a message text.
      A `RegexLiteral` will match patterns inside text, whereas a `StringLiteral` will match patterns at the start of text.

`config`
:     `StringLiteral`, the name of the `Config` member that enables this handler.
      Handlers should be configurable, though a value is not required here to compile or be used in the program.

`command`
:     a `BoolLiteral` which determines if the `HearsHandler` functions as a command.
      If `true`, a "command_disabled" reply will be sent if this handler is not toggled.
types.summary: Annotation for Telegram hears handlers

types.name: HearsHandler
types.doc:
A base class for handling messages whose text matches a certain pattern.

Handlers that are meant to match patterns in text should inherit from this class,
and include an `Hears` annotation to have it be usable by the bot.
types.summary: A base class for handling messages whose text matches a certain pattern.

def.body:
if user.blacklisted?
else

end
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(user.blacklist_reason, services.replies)})
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, user.id, response)

instance_methods.name: karma_reason
instance_methods.doc: Format the *reason* for karma related replies
instance_methods.summary: Format the reason for karma related replies
instance_methods.args_string: (reason : String | Nil, karma_reply : String, services : Services) : String
instance_methods.args_html: (reason : String | Nil, karma_reply : String, services : Services) : String

def.name: karma_reason
def.body:
if reason
else
  return Format.substitute_reply(karma_reply)
end
reason = reason.gsub(/\\+$/, "")
if reason.empty?
  return Format.substitute_reply(karma_reply)
end
karma_reply = karma_reply.gsub(/{karma_reason}([[:punct:]]+(?=\n|\\n))/, "{karma_reason}")
reason = Format.escape_mdv2(reason)
reason = reason.gsub("\n", "\n>")
karma_reply.gsub("{karma_reason}", services.replies.karma_reason.gsub("{reason}", "#{reason}"))

end

instance_methods.name: help
instance_methods.doc: Returns a generated message containing the commands the user can use based on his rank.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a generated message containing the commands the user can use based on his rank.
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, ranks : Hash(Int32, Rank), services : Services) : String

def.name: help
def.body:
ranked = {CommandPermissions::Promote => "/promote [name/OID/ID] [rank] - #{services.descriptions.promote}", CommandPermissions::PromoteSame => "/promote [name/OID/ID] [rank] - #{services.descriptions.promote}", CommandPermissions::PromoteLower => "/promote [name/OID/ID] [rank] - #{services.descriptions.promote}", CommandPermissions::Demote => "/demote [name/OID/ID] [rank] - #{services.descriptions.demote}", CommandPermissions::Ranksay => "/#{ranks[user.rank].name.downcase}say [text] - #{services.descriptions.ranksay}", CommandPermissions::Sign => "/sign [text] - #{services.descriptions.sign}", CommandPermissions::TSign => "/tsign [text] - #{services.descriptions.tsign}", CommandPermissions::Uncooldown => "/uncooldown [name/OID] - #{services.descriptions.uncooldown}", CommandPermissions::Whitelist => "/whitelist [ID] - #{services.descriptions.whitelist}", CommandPermissions::Purge => "/purge - #{services.descriptions.purge}", CommandPermissions::MotdSet => "/motd - #{services.descriptions.motd_set}", CommandPermissions::Unblacklist => "/unblacklist [name/ID]  - #{services.descriptions.unblacklist}"}
reply_required = {CommandPermissions::Upvote => "+1 - #{services.descriptions.upvote}", CommandPermissions::Downvote => "-1 - #{services.descriptions.downvote}", CommandPermissions::Warn => "/warn [reason] - #{services.descriptions.warn}", CommandPermissions::Delete => "/delete [reason] - #{services.descriptions.delete}", CommandPermissions::Spoiler => "/spoiler - #{services.descriptions.spoiler}", CommandPermissions::Remove => "/remove [reason] - #{services.descriptions.remove}", CommandPermissions::Blacklist => "/blacklist [reason] - #{services.descriptions.blacklist}", CommandPermissions::RankedInfo => "/info - #{services.descriptions.ranked_info}", CommandPermissions::Reveal => "/reveal - #{services.descriptions.reveal}", CommandPermissions::Pin => "/pin - #{services.descriptions.pin}", CommandPermissions::Unpin => "/unpin - #{services.descriptions.unpin}"}
String.build do |str|
  str << services.replies.help_header
  str << "\n"
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/start - #{services.descriptions.start}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/stop - #{services.descriptions.stop}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/info - #{services.descriptions.info}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/users - #{services.descriptions.users}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/version - #{services.descriptions.version}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/toggle_karma - #{services.descriptions.toggle_karma}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/toggle_debug - #{services.descriptions.toggle_debug}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/tripcode - #{services.descriptions.tripcode}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/motd - #{services.descriptions.motd}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/help - #{services.descriptions.help}\n"))
  str << (Format.escape_mdv2("/stats - #{services.descriptions.stats}\n"))
  if rank = ranks[user.rank]?
  else
    next
  end
  rank_commands = [] of String
  reply_commands = [] of String
  if rank.command_permissions.includes?(CommandPermissions::RanksayLower)
    lower_ranks = ranks.select do |k, _|
      k <= user.rank && (k != -10)
    end
    lower_ranks.each do |_, v|
      ranksay_permissions = Set {CommandPermissions::Ranksay, CommandPermissions::RanksayLower}
      if (v.command_permissions & ranksay_permissions).empty?
      else
        rank_commands << (Format.escape_mdv2("/#{services.access.ranksay(v.name)}say [text] - #{services.descriptions.ranksay}"))
      end
    end
  end
  rank.command_permissions.each do |permission|
    if ranked.keys.includes?(permission)
      rank_commands << (Format.escape_mdv2(ranked[permission]))
    else
      if reply_required.keys.includes?(permission)
        reply_commands << (Format.escape_mdv2(reply_required[permission]))
      end
    end
  end
  if rank_commands.empty?
  else
    str << "\n"
    str << (Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.help_rank_commands, {"rank" => rank.name}))
    str << "\n"
    rank_commands.each do |line|
      str << "#{line}\n"
    end
  end
  if reply_commands.empty?
  else
    str << "\n"
    str << services.replies.help_reply_commands
    str << "\n"
    reply_commands.each do |line|
      str << "#{line}\n"
    end
  end
end

else

def.name: ranked_info

else

end

else
  return
end
reply_user.remove_cooldown
Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.ranked_info, {"oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id.to_s, "karma" => reply_user.obfuscated_karma.to_s, "cooldown_until" => cooldown_until(reply_user.cooldown_until, services)})

def.name: user_info
def.body:
karma_levels = services.config.karma_levels
if karma_levels.empty?
  current_level = ""
else
  current_level = (karma_levels.find({(..), ""}) do |range, _|
    range === user.karma
  end)[1]
end
user.remove_cooldown
Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.user_info, {"oid" => user.obfuscated_id.to_s, "username" => user.formatted_name, "rank_val" => user.rank.to_s, "rank" => services.access.rank_name(user.rank), "karma" => user.karma.to_s, "karma_level" => current_level.empty? ? nil : "(#{current_level})", "warnings" => user.warnings.to_s, "warn_expiry" => warn_expiry(user.warn_expiry, services), "smiley" => smiley(user.warnings), "cooldown_until" => cooldown_until(user.cooldown_until, services)})

types.name: KarmaHandler
types.doc:
A module that requires users to have a certain amount of karma before sending a message

Each message has a specific among of karma necessary before a message of that type can be sent.
If a message of that type is sent, the amount for that type will be deducted from the user's karma.
types.summary: A module that requires users to have a certain amount of karma before sending a message

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (cutoff_rank : Int32 = 10, karma_text : Int32 = 0, karma_animation : Int32 = 5, karma_audio : Int32 = 2, karma_document : Int32 = 2, karma_video : Int32 = 10, karma_video_note : Int32 = 10, karma_voice : Int32 = 2, karma_photo : Int32 = 5, karma_media_group : Int32 = 10, karma_poll : Int32 = 20, karma_forwarded_message : Int32 = 10, karma_sticker : Int32 = 2, karma_venue : Int32 = 10, karma_location : Int32 = 10, karma_contact : Int32 = 10)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(cutoff_rank, karma_text, karma_animation, karma_audio, karma_document, karma_video, karma_video_note, karma_voice, karma_photo, karma_media_group, karma_poll, karma_forwarded_message, karma_sticker, karma_venue, karma_location, karma_contact)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

types.name: KarmaInfoCommand
types.doc: A command used to obtain information about one's current karma and karma level progress
types.summary: A command used to obtain information about one's current karma and karma level progress

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Returns a message containing the user's karma level progress if karma levels are not empty
instance_methods.summary: Returns a message containing the user's karma level progress if karma levels are not empty

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
karma_levels = services.config.karma_levels
if karma_levels.empty?
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
current_level = next_level = ""
percentage = 0.0_f32
limit = 0
level_keys = karma_levels.keys
level_keys.each_with_index do |range, index|
  if range === user.karma
  else
    next
  end
  current_level = karma_levels[range]
  if range == karma_levels.last_key
    next_level = "???"
    limit = "???"
    percentage = 100.0_f32
  else
    if range == karma_levels.first_key
      next_range = level_keys[index + 1]
      next_level = karma_levels[next_range]
      limit = next_range.begin
      range_begin = range.begin.to_i64
      percentage = (((-range_begin) + user.karma) * 100) / ((-range_begin) + next_range.begin).to_f32
    else
      next_range = level_keys[index + 1]
      next_level = karma_levels[next_range]
      limit = next_range.begin
      percentage = ((user.karma - range.begin) * 100) / (next_range.begin - range.begin).to_f32
    end
  end
end
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.karma_info, {"current_level" => current_level, "next_level" => next_level, "karma" => user.karma.to_s, "limit" => limit.to_s, "loading_bar" => karma_loading_bar(percentage, services), "percentage" => percentage.format(decimal_places: 1, only_significant: true)})
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

instance_methods.name: karma_loading_bar
instance_methods.doc: Formats a loading bar for the /karmainfo command
instance_methods.summary: Formats a loading bar for the /karmainfo command

def.name: karma_loading_bar
def.body:
pips = (percentage.floor.to_i).divmod(10)
if pips[0] != 10
  String.build(10) do |str|
    str << (services.locale.loading_bar[2] * pips[0])
    if pips[1] >= 5
      str << services.locale.loading_bar[1]
    else
      str << services.locale.loading_bar[0]
    end
    str << (services.locale.loading_bar[0] * (10 - (pips[0] + 1)))
  end
else
  services.locale.loading_bar[2] * 10
end

types.name: KarmaSignCommand
types.doc:
Processes karma sign messages before an `UpdateHandler` gets them

This handler expects the command handlers to be registered before the update handlers
types.summary: Processes karma sign messages before an UpdateHandler gets them

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Preformats the given *message* with a karma level signature if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Preformats the given message with a karma level signature if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if message.forward_origin
  return
end
karma_levels = services.config.karma_levels
if karma_levels.empty?
  return
end
text, entities = Format.validate_text_and_entities(message, user, services)
if text
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if spamming?(user, message, arg, services)
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services, arg)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.format_text(text, entities, false, services)
entities = remove_command_entity(text, entities, arg)
current_level = get_karma_level(karma_levels, user)
text, entities = karma_sign(current_level, arg, entities)
if message.text
  message.text = text
  message.entities = entities
else
  if message.caption
    message.caption = text
    message.caption_entities = entities
  end
end
message.preformatted = true

instance_methods.name: get_karma_level
instance_methods.doc: Returns the name of the karma level whose range contains the *user's* karma
instance_methods.summary: Returns the name of the karma level whose range contains the user's karma
instance_methods.args_string: (karma_levels : Hash(Range(Int32, Int32), String), user : User) : String

instance_methods.name: karma_sign
instance_methods.doc: Format the karma level sign based on the given *level* appending the signature to *arg*
instance_methods.summary: Format the karma level sign based on the given level appending the signature to arg
instance_methods.args_string: (level : String, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))
instance_methods.args_html: (level : String, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

def.name: karma_sign
def.body:
signature = "t. #{level}"
signature_size = signature.to_utf16.size
entities.concat([Tourmaline::MessageEntity.new("bold", arg.to_utf16.size + 1, signature_size), Tourmaline::MessageEntity.new("italic", arg.to_utf16.size + 1, signature_size)])
return {"#{arg} #{signature}", entities}

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming karma level signatures

Returns `true` if the user is spamming karma level signatures or unformatted text is spammy, returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming karma level signatures
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, arg : String, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if message.text && (spam.spammy_text?(user.id, arg))
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
if spam.spammy_sign?(user.id, services.config.sign_limit_interval)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.sign_spam)
  return true
end
false

constructors.name: parse_locale
constructors.doc: Parses a file corresponding to the given *language_code* from the locales folder
constructors.summary: Parses a file corresponding to the given language_code from the locales folder

def.name: parse_locale
def.body:
begin
  Localization.from_yaml(File.open(path.join("#{language_code}.yaml")))
rescue ex : YAML::ParseException
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Could not parse the given value at row #{ex.line_number}. This could be because a required value was not set or the wrong type was given."
  end
  exit
rescue ex : File::NotFoundError | File::AccessDeniedError
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Could not open \"./locales/#{language_code}.yaml\". Exiting..."
  end
  exit
end

instance_methods.name: spend_karma

Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for a location message
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for a location message

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_location >= 0
else
  return user
end
