  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_location)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a location message when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for location messages is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a location message when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_location >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_location
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_location.to_s, "type" => "location"}))
end
true

Annotation for Telegram callback query handlers

types.summary: The ID of a Telegram message, stored as a Int64

types.name: MessagePermissions
types.doc:
Message types which can be given to a `Rank` to permit sending messages of that type

## Messages permitted for each type:

`Text`: Text messages without any media

`Animation`: GIFs

`Audio`: Audio files/messages

`Document`: General files

`Video`: Videos

`VideoNote`: Round video/voice messages

`Voice`: Voice messages

`Photo`: Photos

`MediaGroup`: Albums of any kind

`Poll`: Polls

`Forward`: Forwarded messages

`Sticker`:Stickers

`Venue`: Venues

`Location`: Locations

`Contact`: SMS contacts
types.summary: Message types which can be given to a Rank to permit sending messages of that type

types.name: MessageProc
types.aliased: (Proc(Int64, (Tourmaline::ReplyParameters | Nil), Array(Tourmaline::Message)) | Proc(Int64, (Tourmaline::ReplyParameters | Nil), Bool) | Proc(Int64, (Tourmaline::ReplyParameters | Nil), Tourmaline::Message))
types.aliased_html: Int64, Tourmaline::ReplyParameters? -> Array(Tourmaline::Message) | Int64, Tourmaline::ReplyParameters? -> Bool | Int64, Tourmaline::ReplyParameters? -> Tourmaline::Message
types.doc:
The proc associated with a `QueuedMessage`

A `MessageProc` can return the following types:
  - `Tourmaline::Message`: Functions that send text messages, photos, GIFs, and similar items will return a single `Tourmaline::Message`
  - `Array(Tourmaline::Message)`: Functions that send albums/media groups will return an array of the the sent `Tourmaline::Message`
  - `Bool`: Functions that delete, pin, or edit messages will return a `Bool`, where `true` represents a success and `false` represents a failure.
    A `Bool` result is currently not useful to the bot.
types.summary: The proc associated with a QueuedMessage

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  if authorized?(user, message, :MotdSet, services)
  else
    return
  end
  services.database.set_motd(arg)
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.motd_set, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "text" => arg})
  services.relay.log_output(log)
  response = services.replies.success
else
  if motd = services.database.motd
  else
    return
  end
  response = motd
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

instance_methods.name: promote_from_args
instance_methods.doc:
Promotes a user given in the *text* to the *user's* current rank if the rank has the `CommandPermissions::Promote` or `CommandPermissions::PromoteSame` permission
and only one argument (the user's identifier) was given, or promotes to the given rank if the *user's* rank has the `CommandPermissions::Promote` or `CommandPermissions::PromoteLower` permission
and two arguments (the user's identifier and name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.summary: Promotes a user given in the text to the user's current rank if the rank has the CommandPermissions::Promote or CommandPermissions::PromoteSame permission and only one argument (the user's identifier) was given, or promotes to the given rank if the user's rank has the CommandPermissions::Promote or CommandPermissions::PromoteLower permission and two arguments (the user's identifier and name/value of rank) was given
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String | Nil, authority : CommandPermissions, user : User, message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String | Nil, authority : CommandPermissions, user : User, message : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: promote_from_args
def.body:
if (args = Format.get_args(text, count: 2)) && args.size > 0
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if (args.size == 1) && (authority.in?(CommandPermissions::Promote, CommandPermissions::PromoteSame))
  tuple = {user.rank, services.access.ranks[user.rank]}
else
  if args.size == 2
    tuple = services.access.find_rank(args[1].downcase, args[1].to_i?)
  end
end
if tuple
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.no_rank_found, {"ranks" => services.access.rank_names(limit: user.rank).to_s}))
end
if promoted_user = services.database.get_user_by_arg(args[0])
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.no_user_found)
end
if services.access.can_promote?(tuple[0], user.rank, promoted_user.rank, authority)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
promoted_user.set_rank(tuple[0])
services.database.update_user(promoted_user)
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, promoted_user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.promoted, {"rank" => tuple[1].name}))
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.promoted, {"id" => promoted_user.id.to_s, "name" => promoted_user.formatted_name, "rank" => tuple[1].name, "invoker" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.success)

else

end
if promoted_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else

end
if services.access.can_promote?(tuple[0], user.rank, promoted_user.rank, authority)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end

types.name: PurgeCommand
types.doc: A command used to delete all messages sent by recently blacklisted users in one go
types.summary: A command used to delete all messages sent by recently blacklisted users in one go

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc:
Deletes all messages sent by recently blacklisted users for everybody, if *message* meets requirements

A possible `Tourmaline::Error::MessageCantBeDeleted` error can occur when a message's lifespan is 48 hours or greater.
This happens because messages older than 48 hours cannot be deleted for everybody.
As this function deletes messages in descending order (most recent messages are deleted first), the function will error out
when deleting the oldest messages; this is intended due to Telegram API limitations.
instance_methods.summary: Deletes all messages sent by recently blacklisted users for everybody, if message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Purge, services)
else
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
message_count = 0
if banned_users = services.database.blacklisted_users(48.hours)
  msids = Set(MessageID).new
  banned_users.each do |banned_user|
    msids = msids | (services.history.messages_from_user(banned_user.id))
  end
  hash = services.history.purge_receivers(msids)
  hash.each do |receiver, msids_to_delete|
    msids_to_delete.each_slice(100) do |slice|
      services.relay.purge_messages(receiver, slice)
    end
  end
  msids.each do |msid|
    services.history.delete_message_group(msid)
  end
  message_count = message_count + msids.size
end
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.purge_complete, {"msgs_deleted" => message_count.to_s})
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

types.name: RanksayCommand
types.doc:
Processes ranksay messages before an `UpdateHandler` gets them

This handler expects the command handlers to be registered before the update handlers
types.summary: Processes ranksay messages before an UpdateHandler gets them

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Preformats the given *message* with a rank name signature if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Preformats the given message with a rank name signature if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if message.forward_origin
  return
end
if authority = authorized?(user, message, services, :Ranksay, :RanksayLower)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.validate_text_and_entities(message, user, services)
if text
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if spamming?(user, message, arg, services)
  return
end
if rank_name = get_rank_name(text, user, message, authority, services)
else
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services, arg)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.format_text(text, entities, false, services)
entities = remove_command_entity(text, entities, arg)
text, entities = ranksay(rank_name, arg, entities)
if message.text
  message.text = text
  message.entities = entities
else
  if message.caption
    message.caption = text
    message.caption_entities = entities
  end
end
message.preformatted = true
services.relay.log_output(Format.substitute_message(services.logs.ranked_message, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "rank" => rank_name, "text" => arg}))

instance_methods.name: get_rank_name
instance_methods.doc:
For ranksay commands that are not initiated using "/ranksay" and instead uses the name of the rank followed by "-say"

Returns the name of the `Rank` if the rank in the given *text* can ranksay

Returns `nil` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: For ranksay commands that are not initiated using "/ranksay" and instead uses the name of the rank followed by "-say"
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String, user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, authority : CommandPermissions, services : Services) : String | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String, user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, authority : CommandPermissions, services : Services) : String | Nil

def.name: get_rank_name
def.body:
if rank = (text.match(/^\/(.+?)say\s/)).try(&.[](1))
else
  return
end
if rank == "rank"
  parsed_rank = services.access.find_rank(rank, user.rank)
else
  parsed_rank = services.access.find_rank(rank)
end
if parsed_rank
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.no_rank_found, {"ranks" => services.access.rank_names(limit: user.rank).to_s}))
end
parsed_rank_authority = services.access.authorized?(parsed_rank[0], :Ranksay, :RanksayLower)
if services.access.can_ranksay?(parsed_rank[0], user.rank, authority, parsed_rank_authority)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
parsed_rank[1].name

instance_methods.name: ranksay
instance_methods.doc: Format ranksay signature for the given *rank*, appending it to the given *arg*
instance_methods.summary: Format ranksay signature for the given rank, appending it to the given arg
instance_methods.args_string: (rank : String, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))
instance_methods.args_html: (rank : String, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

def.name: ranksay
def.body:
signature = "~~#{rank}"
signature_size = signature.to_utf16.size
entities.concat([Tourmaline::MessageEntity.new("bold", arg.to_utf16.size + 1, signature_size)])
return {"#{arg} #{signature}", entities}

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the forwarded message meets requirements and relays it
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the forwarded message meets requirements and relays it

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Forward, services)
else
  return
end
if deanonymous_poll?(user, message, services)
  return
end
if sufficient_karma?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
text = (message.text || message.caption) || ""
entities = message.entities.empty? ? message.caption_entities : message.entities
if unique?(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
user = spend_karma(user, message, services)
new_message = services.history.new_message(user.id, message.message_id.to_i64)
update_user_activity(user, services)
receivers = message_receivers(user, services)
record_message_statistics(Statistics::Messages::Forwards, services)
if regular_forward?(text, entities)
  return services.relay.send_forward(RelayParameters.new(original_message: new_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers), message.message_id.to_i64)
end
header, entities = get_header(message, entities)
if header
else
  return services.relay.send_forward(RelayParameters.new(original_message: new_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers), message.message_id.to_i64)
end
text = header + text
relay_regular_forward(message, text, entities, new_message, user, receivers, services)

instance_methods.name: forward_header
instance_methods.doc: Returns a 'Forwarded from' header according to the original user which the message came from
instance_methods.summary: Returns a 'Forwarded from' header according to the original user which the message came from
instance_methods.args_string: (message : Tourmaline::Message, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String | Nil, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

def.name: forward_header
def.body:
if origin = message.forward_origin
else
  return {nil, [] of Tourmaline::MessageEntity}
end
if origin.is_a?(Tourmaline::MessageOriginUser)
  if origin.sender_user.is_bot?
    username_forward(origin.sender_user.full_name, origin.sender_user.username, entities)
  else
    user_forward(origin.sender_user.full_name, origin.sender_user.id, entities)
  end
else
  if origin.is_a?(Tourmaline::MessageOriginChannel)
    if origin.chat.username
      username_forward(origin.chat.name, origin.chat.username, entities, origin.message_id)
    else
      private_channel_forward(origin.chat.name, origin.chat.id, entities, origin.message_id)
    end
  else
    if origin.is_a?(Tourmaline::MessageOriginHiddenUser)
      private_user_forward(origin.sender_user_name, entities)
    else
      return {nil, [] of Tourmaline::MessageEntity}
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Returns a 'Forwarded from' header for private channels, removing the "-100" prefix for private channel IDs
instance_methods.summary: Returns a 'Forwarded from' header for private channels, removing the "-100" prefix for private channel IDs
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, id : Int64 | Int32, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), msid : Int64 | Int32 | Nil = nil) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

instance_methods.name: relay_regular_forward
instance_methods.doc: Relays the forwarded message as though it were a text message, album, photo, or similar media type
instance_methods.summary: Relays the forwarded message as though it were a text message, album, photo, or similar media type
instance_methods.args_string: (message : Tourmaline::Message, text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), cached_message : MessageID, user : User, receivers : Array(UserID), services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (message : Tourmaline::Message, text : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity), cached_message : MessageID, user : User, receivers : Array(UserID), services : Services) : Nil

def.name: relay_regular_forward
def.body:
if message.text
  services.relay.send_text(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, text: text, entities: entities, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
else
  if album = message.media_group_id
    if input = album_input(message, text, entities)
    else
      return
    end
    relay_album(@albums, album, message.message_id.to_i64, input, user, receivers, {} of UserID => ReplyParameters, services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil, services)
  else
    if file = message.animation
      services.relay.send_animation(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, media: file.file_id, text: text, entities: entities, spoiler: message.has_media_spoiler?, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
    else
      if file = message.audio
        services.relay.send_audio(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, media: file.file_id, text: text, entities: entities, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
      else
        if file = message.document
          services.relay.send_document(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, media: file.file_id, text: text, entities: entities, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
        else
          if file = message.video
            services.relay.send_video(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, media: file.file_id, text: text, entities: entities, spoiler: message.has_media_spoiler?, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
          else
            if (file = message.photo) && file.last?
              file = file.last
              services.relay.send_photo(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers, media: file.file_id, text: text, entities: entities, spoiler: message.has_media_spoiler?, effect: services.config.allow_effects ? message.effect_id : nil))
            else
              services.relay.send_forward(RelayParameters.new(original_message: cached_message, sender: user.id, receivers: receivers), message.message_id.to_i64)
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

Checks if the user is spamming forwarded messages

Returns `true` if the user is spamming forwarded messages, `false` otherwise

instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_forward?(user.id)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: spend_karma
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` with decremented karma when `KarmaHandler` is enabled and
*user* has sufficient karma for a forwarded message
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User with decremented karma when KarmaHandler is enabled and user has sufficient karma for a forwarded message
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : User

def.name: spend_karma
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return user
end
if karma.karma_forwarded_message >= 0
else
  return user
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return user
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return user
end
user.decrement_karma(karma.karma_forwarded_message)
user

instance_methods.name: sufficient_karma?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a forwarded message when `KarmaHandler` is enabled

Returns `true` if:
  - `KarmaHandler` is not enabled
  - The price for forwarded messages is less than 0
  - The *user's* `Rank` is equal to or greater than the cutoff `Rank`
  - User has sufficient karma

Returns `nil` if the user does not have sufficient karma
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has sufficient karma to send a forwarded message when KarmaHandler is enabled
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool | Nil

def.name: sufficient_karma?
def.body:
if karma = services.karma
else
  return true
end
if karma.karma_forwarded_message >= 0
else
  return true
end
if user.rank >= karma.cutoff_rank
  return true
end
if (album = message.media_group_id) && @albums[album]?
  return true
end
if user.karma >= karma.karma_forwarded_message
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.insufficient_karma, {"amount" => karma.karma_forwarded_message.to_s, "type" => "forward"}))
end
true

instance_methods.name: cache_message
instance_methods.doc: Caches data from the message returned from Telegram in the message `History`
instance_methods.summary: Caches data from the message returned from Telegram in the message History
instance_methods.args_string: (success : Tourmaline::Message | Array(Tourmaline::Message), message : QueuedMessage, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: cache_message
def.body:
case success
when Tourmaline::Message
  services.history.add_to_history(message.origin.as(MessageID), success.message_id.to_i64, message.receiver)
when Array(Tourmaline::Message)
  sent_msids = success.map(&.message_id)
  sent_msids.zip(message.origin.as(Array(MessageID))) do |msid, origin|
    services.history.add_to_history(origin, msid.to_i64, message.receiver)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: relay_message
instance_methods.doc:
Calls the proc associated with the given message.

Returns a `Tourmaline::Message` when sending messages that are not albums
Returns an array of `Tourmaline::Message` for sent albums
Returns nil on sending a system message, Telegram giving us a boolean,
or encountering an error
instance_methods.summary: Calls the proc associated with the given message.
instance_methods.args_string: (message : QueuedMessage, services : Services) : Tourmaline::Message | Array(Tourmaline::Message) | Nil

def.name: relay_message
def.body:
begin
  success = message.function.call(message.receiver, message.reply)
  if message.origin
  else
    return
  end
  if success.is_a?(Bool)
    return
  end
  success
rescue Tourmaline::Error::BotBlocked | Tourmaline::Error::UserDeactivated
  if user = services.database.get_user(message.receiver)
    user.set_left
    services.database.update_user(user)
    log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.force_leave, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name})
    log_output(log)
  end
  reject_inactive_user_messages(message.receiver)
rescue ex : Tourmaline::Error::ChatNotFound
  if message.origin
    Log.error(exception: ex) do
      "Error occured when relaying message."
    end
  end
rescue ex : Tourmaline::Error::RetryAfter
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Error occured when relaying message."
  end
  sleep(ex.seconds.seconds)
  relay_message(message, services)
rescue ex
  Log.error(exception: ex) do
    "Error occured when relaying message."
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Deletes the reply of the given *message* for everybody without given a cooldown and warning to the user who sent it, if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Deletes the reply of the given message for everybody without given a cooldown and warning to the user who sent it, if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Remove, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
original_message = delete_messages(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id, reply_user.debug_enabled, services)
reason = Format.get_arg(message.text)
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.message_removed, {"reason" => Format.reason(reason, services.replies)})
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.message_removed, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "msid" => original_message.to_s, "oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id, "reason" => Format.reason_log(reason, services.logs)})
if original_message
  original_message = ReplyParameters.new(original_message)
end
services.relay.send_to_user(original_message, reply_user.id, response)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

types.name: ReplyParameters
types.doc: Simple alias for `Tourmaline::ReplyParameters`
types.summary: Simple alias for Tourmaline::ReplyParameters

types.name: RespondsTo
types.doc:
Annotation for Telegram command handlers

## Keys and Values:

`command`
:     A `StringLiteral` or an array of `StringLiteral` containing the text that will activate the handler when the text follows a forward slash '/'.
      If using an array of `StringLiteral` to define aliases, the first element in the array will be used for `CommandDescriptions` and registering the command description with BotFather.

`config`
:     `String`, the name of the `Config` member that enables this handler.
      Handlers should be configurable, though a value is not required here to compile or be used in the program.
types.summary: Annotation for Telegram command handlers

types.name: RevealCommand
types.doc: A command used to privately reveal one's username to another user.
types.summary: A command used to privately reveal one's username to another user.

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Privately sends the *message* sender's username signature to the sender of the message this *message* replies to, if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Privately sends the message sender's username signature to the sender of the message this message replies to, if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Reveal, services)
else
  return
end
if (chat = services.relay.get_chat(user.id)) && chat.has_private_forwards?
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.private_sign)
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user.id == user.id
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
if (spam = services.spam) && (spam.spammy_sign?(user.id, services.config.sign_limit_interval))
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.sign_spam)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
receiver_message = services.history.receiver_message(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id)
response = user_reveal(user.id, user.formatted_name, services.replies)
if receiver_message
  receiver_message = ReplyParameters.new(receiver_message)
end
services.relay.send_to_user(receiver_message, reply_user.id, response)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.revealed, {"sender_id" => user.id.to_s, "sender" => user.formatted_name, "receiver_id" => reply_user.id.to_s, "receiver" => reply_user.formatted_name, "msid" => reply.message_id.to_s})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

instance_methods.doc: Returns a link to a given user's account, for reveal messages
instance_methods.summary: Returns a link to a given user's account, for reveal messages
instance_methods.args_string: (id : UserID, name : String, replies : Replies) : String

types.name: Robot9000
types.doc:
A base class for ROBOT9000 implementations

ROBOT9000 is an algorithm by Randall Munroe designed to reduce noise in large chats and
encourage original content.

ROBOT9000 will prevent users from repeating information that has already been posted before.
When a user's post is considered unoriginal, the post will not be sent and the user will be cooldowned.

Subclasses of this type should use a `Database` to store and query unique texts and media IDs
types.summary: A base class for ROBOT9000 implementations

instance_methods.name: add_file_id
instance_methods.doc: Stores the file *id* to be referenced later
instance_methods.summary: Stores the file id to be referenced later

instance_methods.name: add_line
instance_methods.doc: Stores the stripped line of *text* to be referenced later
instance_methods.summary: Stores the stripped line of text to be referenced later

instance_methods.name: allow_text?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if the given *text* has valid codepoints or is empty

Returns `false` if any character/codepoint in the given *text* is not found in `valid_codepoints`
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the given text has valid codepoints or is empty

def.name: allow_text?
def.body:
if text.empty?
  return true
end
if text.codepoints.any? do |codepoint|
  @valid_codepoints.none? do |range|
    range.includes?(codepoint)
  end
end
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: check_forwards?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if this module should check forwards for uniqueness

If true, this module should also check for unique text or media if `check_text` or `check_media` is toggled, respectively.

Returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this module should check forwards for uniqueness

instance_methods.name: check_media?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if this module should check media (photos, audio, videos, etc.) for uniqueness

Returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this module should check media (photos, audio, videos, etc.) for uniqueness

instance_methods.name: check_text?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if this module should check text for uniqueness

Returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if this module should check text for uniqueness

instance_methods.name: cooldown
instance_methods.doc: Returns the cooldown duration for unoriginal messages
instance_methods.summary: Returns the cooldown duration for unoriginal messages

instance_methods.name: media_file_id
instance_methods.doc: Returns a `String` containing the unique file ID from the given *message*
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String containing the unique file ID from the given message

def.name: media_file_id
def.body:
if media = message.animation
else
  if media = message.audio
  else
    if media = message.document
    else
      if media = message.video
      else
        if media = message.video_note
        else
          if media = message.voice
          else
            if media = message.photo.last?
            else
              if media = message.sticker
              else
                return
              end
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end
media.file_unique_id

instance_methods.name: remove_links
instance_methods.doc: Returns a `String` containing the given *text* with URLs removed
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String containing the given text with URLs removed

def.name: remove_links
def.body:
string = text.to_utf16.to_a
entities.reverse.each do |entity|
  if entity.type == "url"
    string.delete_at(entity.offset, entity.length)
  end
end
utf = Slice(UInt16).new(string.size) do |i|
  string[i]
end
String.from_utf16(utf)

instance_methods.name: strip_text
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` containing the given *text* in lower case with the following elements removed:
  - Links/URLS
  - Commands
  - Usernames
  - Sequences of 3 or more repeating characters (digits can repeat)
  - Network links/Back links (i.e., ">>>/foo/")
  - Punctuation and the em-dash
  - Repeating spaces and newlines
  - Trailing and leading whitespace
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String containing the given text in lower case with the following elements removed: - Links/URLS - Commands - Usernames - Sequences of 3 or more repeating characters (digits can repeat) - Network links/Back links (i.e., ">>>/foo/") - Punctuation and the em-dash - Repeating spaces and newlines - Trailing and leading whitespace

def.name: strip_text
def.body:
text = remove_links(text, entities)
text = text.downcase
text = text.gsub(/\/\w+\s/, "")
text = text.gsub(/\s@\w+\s/, " ")
text = text.gsub(/(?![\d])(\w|\w{1,})\1{2,}/) do |_, match|
  match[1]
end
text = text.gsub(/>>>\/\w+\//, "")
text = text.gsub(/[[:punct:]]|/, "")
text = text.gsub(/\s{2,}|\n/, " ")
text.strip

instance_methods.name: unique_media
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the *file_id* if the *message*'s media is unique

Returns `nil` if the *message*'s media is not unique, and cooldowns the sender if configured to do so
instance_methods.summary: Returns the file_id if the message's media is unique
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, file_id : String) : String | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, file_id : String) : String | Nil

def.name: unique_media
def.body:
if unoriginal_media?(file_id)
  if stats = services.stats
    stats.increment_unoriginal_media
  end
  return unoriginal_message(user, message, services)
end
file_id

instance_methods.name: unique_message?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks the *message* for uniqueness and returns `true` if:
  - Message is preformatted (message already checked)
  - Message is a forward, but this `Robot9000` is not configured to check forwards for uniqueness
  - No media file ID could be found when checking message media
  - Message is unique

Returns `false` if the message does not pass the `text_check` or the `media_check`; *message* is unoriginal

The unique text and/or file_id will be stored to flag future messages of the same kind as unoriginal
instance_methods.summary: Checks the message for uniqueness and returns true if: - Message is preformatted (message already checked) - Message is a forward, but this Robot9000 is not configured to check forwards for uniqueness - No media file ID could be found when checking message media - Message is unique
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, text : String | Nil = nil) : Bool
instance_methods.args_html: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, text : String | Nil = nil) : Bool

def.name: unique_message?
def.body:
if message.preformatted?
  return true
end
if message.forward_origin && (!@check_forwards)
  return true
end
if @check_text
  if text
  else
    text = (message.text || message.caption) || ""
  end
  entities = message.caption_entities.empty? ? message.entities : message.caption_entities
  stripped_text = strip_text(text, entities)
  if unique_text = unique_text(user, message, services, stripped_text)
  else
    return false
  end
end
if @check_media
  if file_id = media_file_id(message)
  else
    return true
  end
  if unique_media = unique_media(user, message, services, file_id)
  else
    return false
  end
end
if unique_text
  add_line(unique_text)
end
if unique_media
  add_file_id(unique_media)
end
true

instance_methods.name: unique_text
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the *text* if the *message*'s text or caption is unique

Returns `nil` if the *message*'s text or caption is not unique, and cooldowns the sender if configured to do so
instance_methods.summary: Returns the text if the message's text or caption is unique
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, text : String) : String | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services, text : String) : String | Nil

def.name: unique_text
def.body:
if unoriginal_text?(text)
  if stats = services.stats
    stats.increment_unoriginal_text
  end
  return unoriginal_message(user, message, services)
end

instance_methods.name: unoriginal_message
instance_methods.doc: Queues a message telling the *user* that the *message* was unoriginal, and cooldowns the *user* if configured to do so
instance_methods.summary: Queues a message telling the user that the message was unoriginal, and cooldowns the user if configured to do so
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: unoriginal_message
def.body:
if @cooldown > 0
  duration = user.cooldown(@cooldown.seconds)
  services.database.update_user(user)
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.r9k_cooldown, {"duration" => Format.time_span(duration, services.locale)})
else
  if @warn_user
    duration = user.cooldown(services.config.cooldown_base)
    user.warn(services.config.warn_lifespan)
    services.database.update_user(user)
    response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.r9k_cooldown, {"duration" => Format.time_span(duration, services.locale)})
  else
    response = services.replies.unoriginal_message
  end
end
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

types.name: Services

types.summary: Container for all objects needed for handlers

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates an instance of `Services`.

## Arguments:

`config`
:     `HandlerConfig` object with a limited set of configuration values to be used in subclasses of `Handler` and `CallbackHandler`

`locale`
:     `Locale`, general localized values from a locale file

`replies`
:     `Replies`, system message replies from a locale file

`logs`
:     `Logs`, log messages from a locale file

`command_descriptions`
:     `CommandDescriptions`, descriptions for commands from a locale file

`database`
:     `Database` object

`history`
:     message `History` object

`access`
:     `AuthorizedRanks` module used to ensure authorized use of commands and messages

`relay`
:     `Relay` object for queueing messages and sending them to Telegram

`spam`
:     `SpamHandler` object preventing message spam, if this module is toggled

`robot9000`
:     `Robot9000` object ensure message uniqueness, if this module is toggled

`karma`
:     `KarmaHandler` object that requires users to have karma in order to send messages, if this module is toggled

`stats`
:     `Statistics` object that records data about the bot, if this module is toggled
constructors.args_string: (config : HandlerConfig, locale : Locale, replies : Replies, logs : Logs, descriptions : CommandDescriptions, database : Database, history : History, access : AuthorizedRanks, relay : Relay, spam : SpamHandler | Nil = nil, robot9000 : Robot9000 | Nil = nil, karma : KarmaHandler | Nil = nil, stats : Statistics | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (config : HandlerConfig, locale : Locale, replies : Replies, logs : Logs, descriptions : CommandDescriptions, database : Database, history : History, access : AuthorizedRanks, relay : Relay, spam : SpamHandler | Nil = nil, robot9000 : Robot9000 | Nil = nil, karma : KarmaHandler | Nil = nil, stats : Statistics | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(config, locale, replies, logs, descriptions, database, history, access, relay, spam, robot9000, karma, stats)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Preformats the given *message* with a username signature if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Preformats the given message with a username signature if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if message.forward_origin
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Sign, services)
else
  return
end
if (chat = services.relay.get_chat(user.id)) && chat.has_private_forwards?
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.private_sign)
end
text, entities = Format.validate_text_and_entities(message, user, services)
if text
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if spamming?(user, message, arg, services)
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services, arg)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.format_text(text, entities, false, services)
entities = remove_command_entity(text, entities, arg)
text, entities = user_sign(user.formatted_name, user.id, arg, entities)
if message.text
  message.text = text
  message.entities = entities
else
  if message.caption
    message.caption = text
    message.caption_entities = entities
  end
end
message.preformatted = true

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming username signatures

Returns `true` if the user is spamming username signatures or unformatted text is spammy, returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming username signatures
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, arg : String, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if message.text && (spam.spammy_text?(user.id, arg))
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
if spam.spammy_sign?(user.id, services.config.sign_limit_interval)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.sign_spam)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: user_sign
instance_methods.doc: Format the user sign based on the given *name*, appending the signature to *arg* as a text link to the user's ID
instance_methods.summary: Format the user sign based on the given name, appending the signature to arg as a text link to the user's ID
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, id : UserID, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, id : UserID, arg : String, entities : Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity)) : Tuple(String, Array(Tourmaline::MessageEntity))

def.name: user_sign
def.body:
signature = "~~#{name}"
signature_size = signature.to_utf16.size
entities.concat([Tourmaline::MessageEntity.new("text_link", arg.to_utf16.size + 1, signature_size, url: "tg://user?id=#{id}")])
return {"#{arg} #{signature}", entities}

def.body:
if interval == 0
else

end

instance_methods.name: message_input
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `Tourmaline::InputMedia` from the media contents of the given *message*

Returns `nil` unless message contains a photo, video, or animation/GIF
instance_methods.summary: Returns a Tourmaline::InputMedia from the media contents of the given message

def.name: message_input
def.body:
if media = message.photo.last?
  Tourmaline::InputMediaPhoto.new(media.file_id, caption: message.caption, caption_entities: message.caption_entities, show_caption_above_media: message.show_caption_above_media?)
else
  if media = message.video
    Tourmaline::InputMediaVideo.new(media.file_id, caption: message.caption, caption_entities: message.caption_entities, show_caption_above_media: message.show_caption_above_media?)
  else
    if media = message.animation
      Tourmaline::InputMediaAnimation.new(media.file_id, caption: message.caption, caption_entities: message.caption_entities, show_caption_above_media: message.show_caption_above_media?)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: spoil_messages
instance_methods.doc: Spoils the given media message for all receivers by editing the media with the given input.
instance_methods.summary: Spoils the given media message for all receivers by editing the media with the given input.
instance_methods.args_string: (reply : Tourmaline::Message, user : User, input : Tourmaline::InputMedia, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: spoil_messages
def.body:
if reply_msids = services.history.receivers(reply.message_id.to_i64)
else
  return
end
if reply.has_media_spoiler?
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.unspoiled, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "msid" => reply.message_id.to_s})
else
  input.has_spoiler = true
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.spoiled, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "msid" => reply.message_id.to_s})
end
reply_msids.each do |receiver, receiver_message|
  services.relay.edit_message_media(receiver, input, receiver_message)
end
services.relay.log_output(log)

instance_methods.name: ensure_schema
instance_methods.doc: Ensures that the SQLite database has both a 'system_config' and a 'users' table
instance_methods.summary: Ensures that the SQLite database has both a 'system_config' and a 'users' table

def.name: ensure_schema
def.body:
write do
  @connection.exec("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS system_config (
          name TEXT NOT NULL,
          value TEXT NOT NULL,
          PRIMARY KEY (name)
        )")
  @connection.exec("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
          id BIGINT NOT NULL,
          username TEXT,
          realname TEXT NOT NULL,
          rank INTEGER NOT NULL,
          joined TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
          left TIMESTAMP,
          lastActive TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
          cooldownUntil TIMESTAMP,
          blacklistReason TEXT,
          warnings INTEGER NOT NULL,
          warnExpiry TIMESTAMP,
          karma INTEGER NOT NULL,
          hideKarma TINYINT NOT NULL,
          debugEnabled TINYINT NOT NULL,
          tripcode TEXT,
          PRIMARY KEY(id)
        )")
end

instance_methods.name: expire_warnings
instance_methods.doc:
Queries the database for users with warnings and removes a warning

If the user still has warnings, the next time a warning is removed should
be the current time plus the value of *warn_lifespan*

This should be invoked as a recurring task
instance_methods.summary: Queries the database for users with warnings and removes a warning

def.name: expire_warnings
def.body:
warned_users.each do |user|
  if expiry = user.warn_expiry
    if expiry <= Time.utc
      user.remove_warning(1, warn_lifespan)
      update_user(user)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: ensure_schema
instance_methods.doc: Ensures that there are message_group, receivers, and karma tables in the `Database`
instance_methods.summary: Ensures that there are message_group, receivers, and karma tables in the Database

def.name: ensure_schema
def.body:
write do
  @connection.exec("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON")
  @connection.exec("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS message_groups (
          messageGroupID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          senderID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          sentTime TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
          warned TINYINT NOT NULL,
          PRIMARY KEY (messageGroupID)
        )")
  @connection.exec("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS receivers (
          receiverMSID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          receiverID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          messageGroupID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          PRIMARY KEY (receiverMSID),
          FOREIGN KEY (messageGroupID) REFERENCES message_groups(messageGroupID)
          ON DELETE CASCADE
        )")
  @connection.exec("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS karma (
          messageGroupID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          userID BIGINT NOT NULL,
          PRIMARY KEY (messageGroupID),
          FOREIGN KEY (messageGroupID) REFERENCES receivers(receiverMSID)
          ON DELETE CASCADE
        )")
end

instance_methods.name: expire
instance_methods.doc:
Deletes old messages from the `History`

This should be invoked as a recurring task
instance_methods.summary: Deletes old messages from the History

def.name: expire
def.body:
count = @connection.query_one("SELECT COUNT(messageGroupID)\n        FROM message_groups\n        WHERE sentTime <= ?", Time.utc - @lifespan, as: Int32)
write do
  @connection.exec("DELETE FROM message_groups WHERE sentTime <= ?", Time.utc - @lifespan)
end
if count > 0
  Log.debug do
    "Expired #{count} messages from the cache"
  end
end

instance_methods.name: purge_receivers
instance_methods.doc:
Get a hash containing an array of message IDs to delete associated with the users who received a message in the given set.
Used for the `PurgeCommand`
NOTE: The returned array of message IDs should be sorted in descending order (most recent messages first)
instance_methods.summary: Get a hash containing an array of message IDs to delete associated with the users who received a message in the given set.

def.name: purge_receivers
def.body:
hash = {} of UserID => Array(MessageID)
tuples = @connection.query_all("SELECT receiverID, receiverMSID\n        FROM receivers\n        WHERE receivers.messageGroupID IN (\n          SELECT messageGroupID\n          FROM message_groups\n          WHERE messageGroupID in (#{messages.join(", ") do
  "?"
end})\n        )\n        ORDER BY receiverMSID DESC", args: messages.to_a, as: {UserID, MessageID})
tuples.each do |tuple|
  if hash[tuple[0]]?
    hash[tuple[0]] << tuple[1]
  else
    hash[tuple[0]] = [tuple[1]]
  end
end
hash

instance_methods.name: karma_counts
instance_methods.doc: Returns a hash of `Karma` to `Int32 , containing the total number of karma given or lost, and daily, weekly, and monthly totals
instance_methods.summary: Returns a hash of Karma to `Int32 , containing the total number of karma given or lost, and daily, weekly, and monthly totals

def.name: karma_counts
def.body:
totals = @connection.query_one("
        SELECT
          coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) as total_upvotes,
          coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) as total_downvotes,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now')) as upvotes_daily,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now','-1 day')) as upvotes_yesterday,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-7 days')) as upvotes_weekly,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date < date('now','-7 days') AND date > date('now','-14 days')) as upvotes_yesterweek,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-1 month')) as upvotes_monthly,
          (select coalesce(sum(upvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date < date('now','-1 month') AND date > date('now','-2 months')) as upvotes_yestermonth,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now')) as downvotes_daily,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now','-1 day')) as downvotes_yesterday,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-7 days')) as downvotes_weekly,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date <= date('now','-7 days') AND date > date('now','-14 days')) as downvotes_yesterweek,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-1 month')) as downvotes_monthly,
          (select coalesce(sum(downvotes), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date <= date('now','-1 month') AND date > date('now','-2 months')) as downvotes_yestermonth
        FROM message_stats", as: {Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32})
Hash.zip(Karma.values, totals.to_a)

instance_methods.summary: Returns a hash of Messages to Int32, containing the total number of message for each type and daily, weekly, and monthly totals

def.name: message_counts
def.body:
totals = @connection.query_one("
        SELECT
          coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) as total_messages,
          coalesce(sum(albums), 0) as albums,
          coalesce(sum(animations), 0) as animations,
          coalesce(sum(audio), 0) as audio,
          coalesce(sum(contacts), 0) as contacts,
          coalesce(sum(documents), 0) as documents,
          coalesce(sum(forwards), 0) as forwards,
          coalesce(sum(locations), 0) as locations,
          coalesce(sum(photos), 0) as photos,
          coalesce(sum(polls), 0) as polls,
          coalesce(sum(stickers), 0) as stickers,
          coalesce(sum(text), 0) as text,
          coalesce(sum(venues), 0) as venues,
          coalesce(sum(videos), 0) as videos,
          coalesce(sum(videonotes), 0) as videonotes,
          coalesce(sum(voice), 0) as voice,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now')) as messages_daily,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date = date('now','-1 day')) as messages_yesterday,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-7 days')) as messages_weekly,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date <= date('now','-7 days') AND date > date('now','-14 days')) as messages_yesterweek,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date > date('now','-1 month')) as messages_monthly,
          (select coalesce(sum(total_messages), 0) FROM message_stats WHERE date <= date('now','-1 month') AND date > date('now','-2 months')) as messages_yestermonth
        FROM message_stats", as: {Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32})
Hash.zip(Messages.values, totals.to_a)

          (SELECT count(id) FROM (SELECT * FROM file_id UNION SELECT * FROM text)) as total_unique,

instance_methods.name: user_counts
instance_methods.doc: Returns a hash of `Users` to `Int32`, containing the total number of each kind of user and daily, weekly, and monthly totals
instance_methods.summary: Returns a hash of Users to Int32, containing the total number of each kind of user and daily, weekly, and monthly totals

def.name: user_counts
def.body:
totals = @connection.query_one("
        SELECT
          count(id) as total_users,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE left IS null) as total_joined,
          count(left) as total_left,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE rank = -10) as total_blacklisted,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) = date('now')) as joined_daily,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) = date('now','-1 day')) as joined_yesterday,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) > date('now','-7 days')) as joined_weekly,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) < date('now','-7 days') AND date(joined) > date('now','-14 days')) as joined_yesterweek,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) > date('now','-1 month')) as joined_monthly,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(joined) < date('now','-1 month') AND date(joined) > date('now','-2 months')) as joined_yestermonth,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) = date('now')) as left_daily,
          (SELECT count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) = date('now','-1 day')) as left_yesterday,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) > date('now','-7 days')) as left_weekly,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) <= date('now','-7 days') AND date(left) > date('now','-14 days')) as left_yesterweek,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) > date('now','-1 month')) as left_monthly,
          (select count(id) FROM users WHERE date(left) <= date('now','-1 month') AND date(left) > date('now','-2 months')) as left_yestermonth
        FROM users", as: {Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32})
Hash.zip(Users.values, totals.to_a)

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates an instance of `SQLiteUser`.

## Arguments:

`id`
:     unique `UserID` identifier for this user

`username`
:     username of this user; can be `nil`

`realname`
:     full name (first name + last name) of the user

`rank`
:     rank of this user, corresponding to either -10 (blacklisted) or one of the configurable ranks

`joined`
:     date and time the user joined the chat

`left`
:     date and time the user left the chat; if `nil`, the user is still in the chat

`last_active`
:     date and time the user last sent a message or used a command

`cooldown_until`
:     date and time for until which the user cannot send messages; if `nil`, the user is not in cooldown

`blacklist_reason`
:     described reason for blacklisting the user (see`BlacklistCommand`) ; set to `nil` by default

`warnings`
:     number of warnings the user received from `WarnCommand` or `DeleteCommand`; cooldown times are based off of this value

`warn_expiry`
:     date and time in which one of the `warnings` will be removed; if `nil`, user has no `warnings` to remove

`karma`
:     points the user acquired from upvotes, or lost from downvotes and warnings (see `UpvoteHandler`, `DownvoteHandler`)

`hide_karma`
:     toggle for receiving karma notifications (see `ToggleKarmaCommand`); if `true`, the user will not receive karma notifications

`debug_enabled`
:     toggle for debug mode (see `ToggleDebugCommand`); if `true`, the user will receive a copy of their sent message that everyone else received

`tripcode`
:     a name and password pairing used for generating pseudononyms attached to the user's message; if nil, user has no tripcode
constructors.args_string: (id : Int64, username : String | Nil = nil, realname : String = "", rank : Int32 = 0, joined : Time = Time.utc, left : Time | Nil = nil, last_active : Time = Time.utc, cooldown_until : Time | Nil = nil, blacklist_reason : String | Nil = nil, warnings : Int32 = 0, warn_expiry : Time | Nil = nil, karma : Int32 = 0, hide_karma : Bool | Nil = false, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil = false, tripcode : String | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (id : Int64, username : String | Nil = nil, realname : String = "", rank : Int32 = 0, joined : Time = Time.utc, left : Time | Nil = nil, last_active : Time = Time.utc, cooldown_until : Time | Nil = nil, blacklist_reason : String | Nil = nil, warnings : Int32 = 0, warn_expiry : Time | Nil = nil, karma : Int32 = 0, hide_karma : Bool | Nil = false, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil = false, tripcode : String | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(id, username, realname, rank, joined, left, last_active, cooldown_until, blacklist_reason, warnings, warn_expiry, karma, hide_karma, debug_enabled, tripcode)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: do
def.body:
if info = message.from
else
  return
end
if text = message.text || message.caption
  if text.starts_with?('/')
  else
    return
  end
end
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
  existing_user(user, info.username, info.full_name, message.message_id.to_i64, services)
else

instance_methods.name: existing_user
instance_methods.doc: Handles users attempting to rejoin if they are already in the database
instance_methods.summary: Handles users attempting to rejoin if they are already in the database
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, username : String | Nil, fullname : String, message_id : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (user : User, username : String | Nil, fullname : String, message_id : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: existing_user
def.body:
if user.blacklisted?
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(user.blacklist_reason, services.replies)})
  services.relay.send_to_user(nil, user.id, response)
else
  if user.left?
    user.rejoin
    user.update_names(username, fullname)
    user.set_active
    services.database.update_user(user)
    services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message_id), user.id, services.replies.rejoined)
    log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.rejoined, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name})
    services.relay.log_output(log)
  else
    user.update_names(username, fullname)
    user.set_active
    services.database.update_user(user)
    services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message_id), user.id, services.replies.already_in_chat)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: new_user
instance_methods.doc: Adds the user with the given *id* to the database if registration is open.
instance_methods.summary: Adds the user with the given id to the database if registration is open.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : UserID, username : String | Nil, fullname : String, message_id : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (id : UserID, username : String | Nil, fullname : String, message_id : MessageID, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: new_user
def.body:
if services.config.registration_open
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(nil, id, services.replies.registration_closed)
end
if services.database.no_users?
  user = services.database.add_user(id, username, fullname, services.access.max_rank)
else
  user = services.database.add_user(id, username, fullname, services.config.default_rank)
end
if motd = services.database.motd
  services.relay.send_to_user(nil, id, motd)
end
if services.config.pseudonymous
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message_id), id, services.replies.joined_pseudonym)
else
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message_id), id, services.replies.joined)
end
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.joined, {"id" => id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.log_output(log)

def.name: karma_levels_screen
def.body:
if services.config.karma_levels.empty?
  return services.replies.no_stats_available
end
levels = services.config.karma_levels
karma_records = ""
levels.each do |range, level|
  count = karma_level_count(range.begin, range.end)
  karma_records = karma_records + "#{level}: #{count}\n"
end

instance_methods.name: keyboard_markup
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardMarkup` for the given *next_screen*.

Keyboard buttons are localized and displayed in rows of 3 buttons.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardMarkup for the given next_screen.

def.name: keyboard_markup
def.body:
options = [StatScreens::General, StatScreens::Messages, StatScreens::Users, StatScreens::Karma]
if services.config.karma_levels.empty?
else
  options << StatScreens::KarmaLevels
end
if services.robot9000
  options << StatScreens::Robot9000
end
options.delete(next_screen)
buttons = [] of Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardButton
options.each do |screen|
  buttons << (Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardButton.new(services.locale.statistics_screens[screen], callback_data: "statistics-next=#{screen}"))
end
button_rows = [] of Array(Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardButton)
buttons.each_slice(3) do |slice|
  button_rows << slice
end
Tourmaline::InlineKeyboardMarkup.new(button_rows)

types.doc: A command used to set the user's tripcode, so that it can be used for tripcode signatures
types.summary: A command used to set the user's tripcode, so that it can be used for tripcode signatures

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Sets the user's tripcode or returns the user's tripcode if set when the message meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Sets the user's tripcode or returns the user's tripcode if set when the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  if services.config.flag_signatures
    if valid_signature?(arg)
    else
      invalid_format = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.invalid_tripcode_format, {"valid_format" => services.replies.flag_sign_format})
      return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, invalid_format)
    end
    tripcode = (arg + '#') + user.obfuscated_id
    user.set_tripcode(tripcode)
    name, _ = Format.generate_tripcode(tripcode, services)
    response = tripcode_set(services.replies.flag_sign_set_format, name, "", services)
  else
    if valid_tripcode?(arg)
    else
      invalid_format = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.invalid_tripcode_format, {"valid_format" => services.replies.tripcode_format})
      return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, invalid_format)
    end
    user.set_tripcode(arg)
    name, tripcode = Format.generate_tripcode(arg, services)
    response = tripcode_set(services.replies.tripcode_set_format, name, tripcode, services)
  end
else
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.tripcode_info, {"tripcode" => user.tripcode ? user.tripcode : services.replies.tripcode_unset})
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

instance_methods.name: tripcode_set
instance_methods.doc: Format the tripcode set reply
instance_methods.summary: Format the tripcode set reply
instance_methods.args_string: (set_format : String, name : String, tripcode : String, services : Services) : String
instance_methods.args_html: (set_format : String, name : String, tripcode : String, services : Services) : String

def.name: tripcode_set
def.body:
set_format = set_format.gsub("{name}", Format.escape_mdv2(name))
set_format = set_format.gsub("{tripcode}", Format.escape_mdv2(tripcode))
services.replies.tripcode_set.gsub("{set_format}", set_format)

instance_methods.name: valid_signature?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if the given *arg* is a valid flag signature

Returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the given arg is a valid flag signature

def.name: valid_signature?
def.body:
if arg.graphemes.size > 5
  return false
end
if arg.includes?("\n")
  return false
end
emoji_ranges = [(9728..9983), (917504..917631), (129648..129791), (129280..129535), (127744..128511), (128512..128591), (127462..127487), (65039..65039), (8205..8205)]
if arg.codepoints.any? do |codepoint|
  emoji_ranges.none? do |range|
    range.includes?(codepoint)
  end
end
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: valid_tripcode?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if the given *arg* is a valid tripcode

Returns false otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the given arg is a valid tripcode

def.name: valid_tripcode?
def.body:
if (count = arg.count('#')) && (count == 0)
  return false
end
if (count == 1) && (arg.ends_with?("#"))
  return false
end
if arg.size > 30
  return false
end
if arg.includes?("\n")
  return false
end
true

types.name: TripcodeSignCommand
types.doc:
Processes tripcode sign messages before an `UpdateHandler` gets them

This handler expects the command handlers to be registered before the update handlers
types.summary: Processes tripcode sign messages before an UpdateHandler gets them

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Preformats the given *message* with a tripcode signature header if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Preformats the given message with a tripcode signature header if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if message.forward_origin
  return
end
if tripcode = user.tripcode
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.no_tripcode_set)
end
if authorized?(user, message, :TSign, services)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.validate_text_and_entities(message, user, services)
if text
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if spamming?(user, message, arg, services)
  return
end
if unique?(user, message, services, arg)
else
  return
end
text, entities = Format.format_text(text, entities, false, services)
entities = remove_command_entity(text, entities, arg)
name, tripcode = Format.generate_tripcode(tripcode, services)
if services.config.flag_signatures
  text, entities = Format.flag_sign(name, entities)
else
  text, entities = Format.tripcode_sign(name, tripcode, entities)
end
text = text + arg
if message.text
  message.text = text
  message.entities = entities
else
  if message.caption
    message.caption = text
    message.caption_entities = entities
  end
end
message.preformatted = true

instance_methods.name: spamming?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming tripcode signatures

Returns `true` if the user is spamming tripcode signatures or unformatted text is spammy, returns `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming tripcode signatures
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, arg : String, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: spamming?
def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if message.text && (spam.spammy_text?(user.id, arg))
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.spamming)
  return true
end
if spam.spammy_sign?(user.id, services.config.sign_limit_interval)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.sign_spam)
  return true
end
false

types.name: UnblacklistCommand
types.doc: A command used to unban a user in the bot
types.summary: A command used to unban a user in the bot

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Unbans a user via a username or unique ID if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Unbans a user via a username or unique ID if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Unblacklist, services)
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if unblacklisted_user = services.database.get_user_by_arg(arg)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.no_user_found)
end
if unblacklisted_user.rank == -10
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
unblacklisted_user.set_rank(services.config.default_rank)
unblacklisted_user.rejoin
services.database.update_user(unblacklisted_user)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.unblacklisted, {"id" => unblacklisted_user.id.to_s, "name" => unblacklisted_user.formatted_name, "invoker" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, unblacklisted_user.id, services.replies.unblacklisted)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Removes a cooldown and warning from a user if the user is currently cooldowned.
instance_methods.summary: Removes a cooldown and warning from a user if the user is currently cooldowned.

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Uncooldown, services)
else
  return
end
if arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if uncooldown_user = services.database.get_user_by_arg(arg)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.no_user_found)
end
if cooldown_until = uncooldown_user.cooldown_until
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.not_in_cooldown)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
uncooldown_user.remove_cooldown(true)
uncooldown_user.remove_warning(1, services.config.warn_lifespan.hours)
services.database.update_user(uncooldown_user)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.removed_cooldown, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "oid" => uncooldown_user.obfuscated_id, "cooldown_until" => cooldown_until.to_s})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

types.name: UnpinCommand
types.doc: A command for unpinning messages from the chat
types.summary: A command for unpinning messages from the chat

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Unpins the most recently pinned message or the message that *message* replies to if the *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Unpins the most recently pinned message or the message that message replies to if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Unpin, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = message.reply_to_message
  if services.history.sender(reply.message_id.to_i64)
  else
    return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.not_in_cache)
  end
  (services.history.receivers(reply.message_id.to_i64)).each do |receiver, receiver_message|
    services.relay.unpin_message(receiver, receiver_message)
  end
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.unpinned, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "msid" => reply.message_id.to_s})
else
  services.database.active_users.each do |receiver|
    services.relay.unpin_message(receiver)
  end
  log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.unpinned_recent, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name})
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

Handlers that are meant to work with Telegram updates should inherit this class,

instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if user is authorized to send this type of message (one of the `MessagePermissions` types).

Returns `false` otherwise.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if user is authorized to send this type of message (one of the MessagePermissions types).
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, authority : MessagePermissions, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: authorized?
def.body:
if services.access.authorized?(user.rank, authority)
else
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.media_disabled, {"type" => authority.to_s})
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)
  return false
end
true

instance_methods.name: deny_user
instance_methods.doc: Queues a system reply when the user cannot chat due to being either cooldowned, blacklisted, media limited, or left.
instance_methods.summary: Queues a system reply when the user cannot chat due to being either cooldowned, blacklisted, media limited, or left.

def.name: deny_user
def.body:
if user.blacklisted?
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.blacklisted, {"contact" => Format.contact(services.config.blacklist_contact, services.replies), "reason" => Format.reason(user.blacklist_reason, services.replies)})
else
  if cooldown_until = user.cooldown_until
    response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.on_cooldown, {"time" => Format.time(cooldown_until, services.locale.time_format)})
  else
    if (Time.utc - user.joined) < services.config.media_limit_period
      response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.media_limit, {"total" => Format.time_span(services.config.media_limit_period - (Time.utc - user.joined), services.locale)})
    else
      response = services.replies.not_in_chat
    end
  end
end
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, user.id, response)
