instance_methods.name: reply_receivers
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a hash of a receiver's `UserID` to the relevant message ID for which this message will reply to when relayed.
When quoting, the `ReplyParameters` value will contain the replied message's quote if it is not invalid (i.e., user quoted his own message and it had strippable entities or was edited)

The hash will be empty if the message does not have a reply

Returns nil if the message had a reply, but no receiver message IDs could be found (message replied to is no longer in the cache)
instance_methods.summary: Returns a hash of a receiver's UserID to the relevant message ID for which this message will reply to when relayed.
instance_methods.args_string: (message : Tourmaline::Message, user : User, services : Services) : Hash(UserID, ReplyParameters) | Nil

def.name: reply_receivers
def.body:
if reply = message.reply_to_message
else
  return Hash(UserID, ReplyParameters).new
end
replies = services.history.receivers(reply.message_id.to_i64)
if reply && replies.empty?
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.not_in_cache)
end
quote = message.quote
if (from = reply.from) && (from.id == user.id)
  reply_entities = reply.entities.map(&.type)
  stripped_reply_entities = reply_entities - services.config.entity_types
  if (stripped_reply_entities == reply_entities) && (reply.edit_date == nil)
  else
    quote = nil
  end
end
if quote
  replies.transform_values do |val|
    ReplyParameters.new(message_id: val, quote: quote.text, quote_entities: quote.entities, quote_position: quote.position)
  end
else
  replies.transform_values do |val|
    ReplyParameters.new(val)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: user_from_message
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` associated with the message if the `User` could be found in the `Database`.
This will also update the `User`'s username and realname if they have changed since the last message.

Returns `nil`  if:
  - Message has no sender
  - Message is a command
  - `User` does not exist in the `Database`
  - `User` cannot chat right now (due to a cooldown, blacklist, media limit, or having left the chat)
instance_methods.summary: Returns the User associated with the message if the User could be found in the Database.

def.name: user_from_message
def.body:
if info = message.from
else
  return
end
if text = message.text
  return_on_command(text)
end
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(nil, info.id.to_i64, services.replies.not_in_chat)
end
if text
  if user.can_chat?
  else
    return deny_user(user, services)
  end
else
  if user.can_chat?(services.config.media_limit_period)
  else
    return deny_user(user, services)
  end
end
user.update_names(info.username, info.full_name)
user

macros.name: return_on_command
macros.doc:
Returns early if the message *text* contains a command.

Iterates through all `HearsHandlers` that are meant to be commands,
and returns early if the handler matches a substring in the text (for `RegexLiteral` patterns)
or if the handler starts with a substring (for `StringLiteral` patterns)
macros.summary: Returns early if the message text contains a command.

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Upvotes the message that the given *message* replies to if it meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Upvotes the message that the given message replies to if it meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Upvote, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if spamming?(user, message, services)
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
if upvote_message(user, reply_user, message, reply, services)
else
  return
end

instance_methods.name: karma_level_up
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the user has gained a karma level when karma levels are set, and if so, queues a 'leveled up' response
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user has gained a karma level when karma levels are set, and if so, queues a 'leveled up' response
instance_methods.args_string: (reply_user : User, reply_parameters : ReplyParameters | Nil, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: karma_level_up
def.body:
if services.config.karma_levels.empty?
  return
end
next_level = services.config.karma_levels.find(nil) do |range, _|
  range.begin == reply_user.karma
end
if next_level
else
  return
end
services.relay.send_to_user(reply_parameters, reply_user.id, Format.substitute_message(services.replies.karma_level_up, {"level" => next_level[1]}))

instance_methods.name: send_replies
instance_methods.doc:
Queues 'gave upvote' and 'got upvoted' replies for the *user* and *reply_user*, respectively

Includes a reason for the upvote if karma reasons are enabled.
instance_methods.summary: Queues 'gave upvote' and 'got upvoted' replies for the user and reply_user, respectively
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, reply_user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Nil

def.name: send_replies
def.body:
if services.config.karma_reasons
  reason = Format.get_arg(message.text)
  if reason
    reason = truncate_karma_reason(reason)
    services.relay.log_output(Format.substitute_message(services.logs.upvoted, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id, "reason" => reason}))
  end
end
gave_upvote_reply = karma_reason(reason, services.replies.gave_upvote, services)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, gave_upvote_reply)
if reply_user.hide_karma
else
  reply_msid = services.history.receiver_message(reply.message_id.to_i64, reply_user.id)
  if reply_msid
    reply_parameters = ReplyParameters.new(reply_msid)
  end
  karma_level_up(reply_user, reply_parameters, services)
  got_upvote_reply = karma_reason(reason, services.replies.got_upvote, services)
  services.relay.send_to_user(reply_parameters, reply_user.id, got_upvote_reply)
end

instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the user is spamming upvotes

Returns `true` if the user is spamming upvotes, `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the user is spamming upvotes
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.body:
if spam = services.spam
else
  return false
end
if spam.spammy_upvote?(user.id, services.config.upvote_limit_interval)
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.upvote_spam)
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: upvote_message
instance_methods.doc:
Adds user's upvote to message history and update reply_user's karma
Returns false if user has already upvoted the message or user attempted
to give himself karma
instance_methods.summary: Adds user's upvote to message history and update reply_user's karma Returns false if user has already upvoted the message or user attempted to give himself karma
instance_methods.args_string: (user : User, reply_user : User, message : Tourmaline::Message, reply : Tourmaline::Message, services : Services) : Bool

def.name: upvote_message
def.body:
if user.id == reply_user.id
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.upvoted_own_message)
  return false
end
if !(services.history.add_rating(reply.message_id.to_i64, user.id))
  services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.already_voted)
  return false
end
reply_user.increment_karma
services.database.update_user(reply_user)
true

instance_methods.name: user_from_message
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the `User` associated with the message if the `User` could be found in the `Database`.
This will also update the `User`'s username and realname if they have changed since the last message.

Returns `nil`  if:

def.name: user_from_message
def.body:

end
if user = services.database.get_user(info.id.to_i64)
else

end
if user.can_use_command?
else

end

types.name: User
types.doc:
A reprentation of a Telegram user.

All users require an ID, which is obtained from the Telegram user (`Tourmaline::User`).
This ID should be unique and stored as a `UserID`.

`Database` implementations should have their own `User` type that inherits
from this class and is modified to work with the given implementation.
types.summary: A reprentation of a Telegram user.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates an instance of `User`.

## Arguments:

`id`
:     unique `UserID` identifier for this user

`username`
:     username of this user; can be `nil`

`realname`
:     full name (first name + last name) of the user

`rank`
:     rank of this user, corresponding to either -10 (blacklisted) or one of the configurable ranks

`joined`
:     date and time the user joined the chat

`left`
:     date and time the user left the chat; if `nil`, the user is still in the chat

`last_active`
:     date and time the user last sent a message or used a command

`cooldown_until`
:     date and time for until which the user cannot send messages; if `nil`, the user is not in cooldown

`blacklist_reason`
:     described reason for blacklisting the user (see`BlacklistCommand`) ; set to `nil` by default

`warnings`
:     number of warnings the user received from `WarnCommand` or `DeleteCommand`; cooldown times are based off of this value

`warn_expiry`
:     date and time in which one of the `warnings` will be removed; if `nil`, user has no `warnings` to remove

`karma`
:     points the user acquired from upvotes, or lost from downvotes and warnings (see `UpvoteHandler`, `DownvoteHandler`)

`hide_karma`
:     toggle for receiving karma notifications (see `ToggleKarmaCommand`); if `true`, the user will not receive karma notifications

`debug_enabled`
:     toggle for debug mode (see `ToggleDebugCommand`); if `true`, the user will receive a copy of their sent message that everyone else received

`tripcode`
:     a name and password pairing used for generating pseudononyms attached to the user's message; if nil, user has no tripcode
constructors.args_string: (id : UserID, username : String | Nil = nil, realname : String = "", rank : Int32 = 0, joined : Time = Time.utc, left : Time | Nil = nil, last_active : Time = Time.utc, cooldown_until : Time | Nil = nil, blacklist_reason : String | Nil = nil, warnings : Int32 = 0, warn_expiry : Time | Nil = nil, karma : Int32 = 0, hide_karma : Bool | Nil = false, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil = false, tripcode : String | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (id : UserID, username : String | Nil = nil, realname : String = "", rank : Int32 = 0, joined : Time = Time.utc, left : Time | Nil = nil, last_active : Time = Time.utc, cooldown_until : Time | Nil = nil, blacklist_reason : String | Nil = nil, warnings : Int32 = 0, warn_expiry : Time | Nil = nil, karma : Int32 = 0, hide_karma : Bool | Nil = false, debug_enabled : Bool | Nil = false, tripcode : String | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(id, username, realname, rank, joined, left, last_active, cooldown_until, blacklist_reason, warnings, warn_expiry, karma, hide_karma, debug_enabled, tripcode)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: cooldown
instance_methods.doc: Gives the user an exponentially increasing cooldown from the given *base* value and current number of `warnings`
instance_methods.summary: Gives the user an exponentially increasing cooldown from the given base value and current number of #warnings

def.name: cooldown
def.body:
begin
  warnings = @warnings
  if @warnings < 0
    warnings = 0
  end
  duration = base ** warnings
rescue OverflowError
  duration = 525950
end
if duration > 525950
  duration = 52.weeks
else
  duration = duration.minutes
end
@cooldown_until = Time.utc + duration
duration

instance_methods.doc:

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
counts = services.database.user_counts
if services.access.authorized?(user.rank, :Users)
  response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.user_count_full, {"joined" => (counts[:total] - counts[:left]).to_s, "left" => counts[:left].to_s, "blacklisted" => counts[:blacklisted].to_s, "total" => counts[:total].to_s})
else

end
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, response)

types.name: WarnCommand
types.doc: A command used to give a user a warning and a cooldown without deleting the message
types.summary: A command used to give a user a warning and a cooldown without deleting the message

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc:
Warns the user who sent a message the given *message* replies to if the *message* meets requirements

Warning a message will give the sender a warning and a cooldown, but will not delete the message
instance_methods.summary: Warns the user who sent a message the given message replies to if the message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Warn, services)
else
  return
end
if reply = reply_message(user, message, services)
else
  return
end
if reply_user = reply_user(user, reply, services)
else
  return
end
if services.history.warned?(reply.message_id.to_i64)
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.already_warned)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
services.history.add_warning(reply.message_id.to_i64)
duration = reply_user.cooldown(services.config.cooldown_base)
reply_user.warn(services.config.warn_lifespan)
reply_user.decrement_karma(services.config.warn_deduction)
services.database.update_user(reply_user)
original_message = services.history.origin_message(reply.message_id.to_i64)
reason = Format.get_arg(message.text)
cooldown_until = Format.time_span(duration, services.locale)
response = Format.substitute_reply(services.replies.cooldown_given, {"reason" => Format.reason(reason, services.replies), "duration" => cooldown_until})
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.warned, {"id" => user.id.to_s, "name" => user.formatted_name, "oid" => reply_user.obfuscated_id, "duration" => cooldown_until, "reason" => Format.reason_log(reason, services.logs)})
if original_message
  original_message = ReplyParameters.new(original_message)
end
services.relay.send_to_user(original_message, reply_user.id, response)
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

types.name: WhitelistCommand
types.doc: A command used to whitelist users through the Telegram bot
types.summary: A command used to whitelist users through the Telegram bot

instance_methods.name: do
instance_methods.doc: Whitelists a user, allowing them to join the chat, if the given *message* meets requirements
instance_methods.summary: Whitelists a user, allowing them to join the chat, if the given message meets requirements

def.name: do
def.body:
if user = user_from_message(message, services)
else
  return
end
if authorized?(user, message, :Whitelist, services)
else
  return
end
if services.config.registration_open
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.fail)
end
if (arg = Format.get_arg(message.text)) && (arg = arg.to_i64?)
else
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.missing_args)
end
if services.database.get_user(arg)
  return services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.already_whitelisted)
end
update_user_activity(user, services)
services.database.add_user(arg, "", "WHITELISTED", services.config.default_rank)
services.relay.send_to_user(nil, arg, services.replies.added_to_chat)
log = Format.substitute_message(services.logs.whitelisted, {"id" => arg.to_s, "invoker" => user.formatted_name})
services.relay.log_output(log)
services.relay.send_to_user(ReplyParameters.new(message.message_id), user.id, services.replies.success)

types.name: Tourmaline
types.doc:
Tourmaline is a Telegram Bot API library
for [Telegram](https://telegram.com). It provides an easy to
use interface for creating telegram bots, and using the
various bot APIs that Telegram provides.

For usage examples, see the
[examples](https://github.com/watzon/tourmaline/tree/master/examples)
directory. For guides on using Tourmaline, see the official
Tourmaline [cookbook](https://tourmaline.dev/docs/cookbook/your-first-bot).
types.summary: Tourmaline is a Telegram Bot API library for Telegram.

types.name: Message
types.doc: This object represents a message.
types.summary: This object represents a message.

instance_methods.name: preformatted=
instance_methods.doc:
Set to `true` if the message is preformatted (in case a command handler alters the message before an update handler gets it)

Set to `false` otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Set to true if the message is preformatted (in case a command handler alters the message before an update handler gets it)
